characters: FLUTTER OF EYES, FLICK OF HAIR, PUFF OF CHEST".
DURING THE CLOSING CREDITS SIMONE PERFORMS ANOTHER SONG F
PATSY CLINE, ELLA FITZGERALD, ARETHA FRANKLIN, JANICE JOP
SIMONE APPEARS IN A MUSIC VIDEO.
"ETERNITY FOREVER" HAS BIG FUTURE AT B.O.
A TITLE APPEARS ON THE SCREEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The colored shapes dart around the screen -- the impressi of looking through a kaleidoscope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the image comes into sharp focus, we discover that we inside a CANDY BOWL.  A MAN'S FINGERS are frantically removing all the cherry-flavored pieces of candy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man performing this curious task is writer/producer/director, VIKTOR TARANSKY, forties, conservatively dressed in suit and tie.  He sits alone at empty craft service table outside a cavernous soundstage, some distance from the rest of the film set -- a breeze b the table's paper cloth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor finishes sorting.  Finding no trash can to deposit rejected cherry candy, he scoops them into his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A young headset-clad P.A. hurriedly approaches.  He looks ill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Taransky --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor reads the young P.A.'s panicked expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's walking?... Don't tell me she's walking. (blood slowly draining from his face) She is not walking... She can't walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLA ANDERS, twenty-something, A-list actress, beautifu face scowling, is supervising her ASSISTANT ferrying clot from a movie trailer to a limousine.  VIKTOR desperately follows after Nicola.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Nicola!  How was your massage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in breach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Is this about the new pages? -- I made the changes you wanted, you're in virtually every scene --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wheeling on him) It's not the size of the role, Viktor. (suddenly very cool) Am I or am I not contractually entitled to the biggest trailer on the set?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (regarding the enormous silver fish behind them, confused) It's the biggest on earth!  I swear!  It's a 50-foot Airstream -- they don't make them any longer than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taller, Viktor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taller?  What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor looks up in horror.  The trailer next to Nicola's indeed appear to be fractionally taller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walking away) You've insulted me for the last time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor looks to the tires.  His face suddenly brightens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicola, it's just the tires -- they're over-inflated!  I can fix it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor grasps the air nozzle on a tire and begins despera stabbing at it with a ballpoint pen.  Air hisses out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, it's lower already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicola ignores Viktor, marching towards her limo with her PUBLICIST.  Abandoning the trailer, Viktor hurries after

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I beg you.  You can't do this to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking back) I had three other offers.  I only signed on to this picture out of... loyalty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then show some.  They'll shut me down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (opening the car door) It wasn't working anyhow.  The scene with the thousand geese -- I don't understand this film.  I don't think anyone will understand it.  I already put out a press release -- citing "creative differences".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor stops, nods resignedly -- suddenly very calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what, Nicola, you're right. (picking up her last piece of luggage) Here, let me help you with that. (holding the door for her) You ought to go.  The truth is I don't deserve you.  This film doesn't deserve you.  Frankly, it deserves much, much better.  The reason it's not working is because you're not about the work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicola is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the limo driver) To Hell, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door slams and the limo roars away.  Viktor looks to still hissing trailer tire.  The CREW regards Viktor apprehensively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the crew) What are you looking at?  Get back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew is uncertain what work there is to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In an ornate bedroom, NICOLA lies on her death bed under veil of netting.  A distraught man, HAL, sits close by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispered) Jack... are you there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here.  I'm right beside you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A NUN enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hal) You should really go now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's alright.  Please, let him stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nun withdraws.  Hal holds his face in his hands, almo breaking down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a glance to heaven) What kind of cruel God is it that would take you away from me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same one who brought me to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I cannot accept it.  If something like this can happen.  What... (struggling to find the words) What is it for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles through her pain) -- Why are we here?  Is that what you're asking, Jack?... Why are we here?  No why.  Just here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicola dies peacefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR sits with leading man HAL, THREE EXECUTIVES and st head ELAINE CHRISTIAN, watching a rough assembly of the f It ends with a close up of NICOLA ANDERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights go up.  The image of Nicola fades off the scre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's good.  You can hardly tell she's reading off a teleprompter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring him) I've analyzed the footage.  We've got almost everything we need in the can.  If we rework the script, we can finish the film without her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (forceful shake of the head) According to the writ her attorneys filed at noon today.  They'll sue if the film is released with Nicola in a single frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (more anxious) So we'll re-cast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicola Anders is the only actress who can play that role.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) It's a re-make, Hal.  Anders is not bigger than this picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine finally speaks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course she is.  No other name is going to sign on now and risk offending her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't need a name.  We'll cast an unknown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't play opposite an unknown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't sell an unknown.  Nicola's soured on the project and we have to accept that.  If we ever want to be in the Nicola Anders business again, we have to cut our losses and shelve the picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The executives, leading man and director nod sagely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aghast) No!  You will not give in to that blackmailing bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a wince, addressing everyone but Viktor) Excuse us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine ushers Viktor out of the screening room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE and VIKTOR talk in the shadow of an enormous soundstage.  They speak more freely in each other's compa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, Viktor.  Why do you always have to make things so difficult for yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Difficult.  I'm difficult.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He produces a handful of candy from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (referring to the candy) -- Do you know what these are, Elaine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (talking a piece of candy and eating it) Hmm... Mike and Ike's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not just any Mike & Ike's -- cherry Mike & Ike's.  Do you know why I, Viktor Taransky, two-time Academy Award nominated director --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Viktor, that was Short Subject.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- overseeing the most cherished movie project of my career, am walking around with a pocketful of cherry Mike & Ike's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine takes a seat in a nearby studio cart as Viktor pac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I have a feeling you're going to tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I'll tell you why.  It is because Miss Nicola Anders, supermodel with a SAG card God's gift to cinema, has it written into her contract that all cherry Mike & Ike's be removed from her candy dish along with strict instructions that any room she walks into should have seven packs of cigarettes waiting for her three of them opened, that there be a personal jacuzzi within eighty paces of her dressing room, and that any time she travels, her nanny must fly with her first class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- What's wrong with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine, she doesn't have any children! (grabbing her arm) Don't you see?  We're being held hostage by 12 men and 5 women who someone somewhere has decreed are the A-list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The public decides who's on that list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the truth.  Those 17 superstars are our insurance policy.  We can't open -- can't make a profit without them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can hardly make a profit with them.  Up-front salary, back-end deal, perks, per diem, percentages  -- They're mocking us, Elaine.  We're at their mercy. (staring wistful, into space) We always had movie stars but they used to be our stars.  We used to decide who would play what role.  We told them what to wear, what to say, who to date.  When they were under contract, we could change their names if we wanted to -- more than once!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (regarding him as if he's insane) You realize you're nostalgic for an era you weren't even born in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritated at her infuriating logic) Well, I do remember why I started out in this business -- you seem to have forgotten -- working in New York with Cassevetes -- we were trying to do something important, shine a light in that darkened cinema --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rolling her eyes) -- It's called a projector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring her) -- Illuminate hearts and minds with a ray of truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Viktor, I have good memories of those days too -- but this isn't about that or you or me or some high-minded ideal.  This is business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spare me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gesturing at the studio lot) -- Christ, Viktor, look around.  What do you think pays for all this?  This is about investment and return.  Those days in New York... that's... it's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause.  Viktor reads Elaine's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not renewing my contract.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can I?  Your last three pictures tanked.  The board is giving me hell.  No bankable star will work with you after this.  If you just compromised... a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor eats some of the candy in his hand as he takes in news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rueful smile) -- Well, it's not every day you're fired by the mother of your own child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine also eats some more candy -- a curiously intimate moment between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softening, a heart-to heart) I'm not taking away your daughter, just your deal.  You and I both know, after the divorce I kept you on for old time's sake, so you could still hold your head up in front of Lainey.  I called what's his name at Warner's.  He said he'd take a meeting -- in July.  I've fought for you Viktor... (voice trails off) You want to talk severance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring off into the distance, face hardening) You can have everything -- office, car, assistants -- all I want is the picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) The picture's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So there's no problem -- I can have the rights, the negative too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (believing she's getting off lightly) They're yours.  But how are you going to finish it?  Without a star there's no movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need a star.  All I need is an actor -- I'll reshoot the part, cut out Nicola and replace her with a real actor.  A real leading lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even if you find her, you know the problem with unknowns, Viktor.  If they're good, they get known.  And then you're back to sorting their candy... and worse. (kissing him on the cheek as she departs in her studio golf cart) I'm sorry, Viktor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor watches her depart down the canyon of stages, left alone on the deserted lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty NICOLA ANDERS' FACES jiggle into frame.  VIKTOR's appears amongst them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are cardboard figures, standing together in the trai of an electric cart.  A WORKMAN is collecting the promoti standees from around the lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR places his hands on the neck of a cardboard cut-ou we sense he is about to rip her head off -- when a fourte year old girl, LAINEY, appears beside him, carrying a lap computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slightly ashamed) Hello, sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor, embarrassed by his childishness, steps aside for suspicious workman who carries the standee away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lainey smiles sweetly.  She hugs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry Mom canned you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugging) It's really... not anything, Lainey.  It's just --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't feel too bad. (glancing to a standee) Mom runs the place and they still walk all over her.  You're better off out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (regarding his daughter) You look very grown up.  What are you doing?  You meeting your mom for dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances towards the entrance where Lainey's mother, ELAINE, and her dependable, uncomplicated businessman boyfriend, KENT, wait beside Elaine's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reluctant admission) Kent got tickets to the ballet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor shakes the idea of Kent and Elaine from his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to convince himself as much as Lainey) I'm going to finish the picture, sweetheart.  It's important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not quite convinced) I know you'll do it, Dad.  You're Viktor Taransky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lainey kisses the forlorn Viktor goodbye.  She runs to he mother and Kent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) That's right.  I'm Viktor Taransky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a distance ELAINE and KENT regard the lonely figure VIKTOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had no choice, Elaine.  He's a liability.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wistful look to Viktor) He also happens to be the most talented man I've ever known.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine climbs in the car as Lainey approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE UP on a copy of "Variety".  The front page banner headline: "ANDERS RIDES OUT OF 'SUNSET' -- Cites Creative Differences"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man reading the trade paper sits in the back of a tra a studio tour -- HANK ALENO.  He wears a pair of spectacl with one lens blacked out, his head tilted on one side. is an item buried on the inside pages that catches Hank's good eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "OVER-PRICED, OVER-PAMPERED PRIMA DONNAS" - Director's Future Now In Doubt -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tram pauses.  The TOUR GUIDE keeps up a commentary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- On your left, the house where Claris Commodore uttered those now immortal words, "If that door doesn't hold, stand behind me".  And coming up on your right --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the tram departs, we discover that Hank has exited t tram and is hiding in the facade of a New York subway entrance.  The tag around his neck reads, "VISITOR -- Sta With The Tour".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR wheels a stack of film cans on a dolly while holdi several framed black and white photographs of screen lege under his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANK, hiding in the shadows of the soundstages, spies Vik He hurries towards him as Viktor approaches his antiquate Bentley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Mr. Taransky, Mr. Taransky... thank God.  I've been trying to see you, calling -- Your assistant wouldn't put me through.  I told her it was a matter of life and death.  I was afraid I wouldn't get to you in time --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (using his stack of film cans as a barrier) -- Please, get away from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did it, Mr. Taransky.  I licked skin.  I licked hair.  I licked every part of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (more disturbed, fearing he is dealing with a pervert) You want me to call Security?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have her, Mr. Taransky.  The answer to your prayers. (producing the "Variety" article, conspiratorial) The answer to this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (regarding the article) I was misquoted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have your new leading lady... (indicating the bulge in his pocket) ... right here in my pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor takes a step back, concerned once again about the man's motives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to reassure) It's me, Mr. Taransky.  Don't you recognize me? -- The Future of Film conference in San Jose.  Hank... Hank Aleno.  I was keynote speaker.  You must remember my speech... "Who Needs Humans?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (faint glimmer of recognition) That's right.  You were booed off the stage.  That's got to be -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Eight years ago.  In that whole time, I never left my computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wary) Good for you, Hank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (referring to his covered eye) Good and bad.  They think that's what caused this.  Me eye tumor.  Microwaves from the screen.  It's the size of a grapefruit.  Heavy too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (regarding the pathetic figure with the tilted head) I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be.  It was worth it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hank once again indicated the bulge in his pocket.  Vikto now understands the significance of the gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to see her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loading cans into the car) I've seen them all before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not like this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (patronizing smile) Come on, Hank.  A synthespian, virtual actor -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritated) -- We call them "vactors".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need flesh and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Flesh is weak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- a living, breathing actor -- I can't work with a fake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor loads his film cans into the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to Nicola in Variety) You already do.  But my actor won't get old, fat, lazy or drunk -- won't throw tantrums, demand a body double, script changes or a bigger trailer. (whispers, conspiratorial) The Disney Corporation has been using artificial actors for years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the point, Hank.  No matter how good they are, they're still Mickey Mouse.  Everyone's tried.  Everyone's failed.  It can't be done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can -- with my new computer code, you and me, we can do it together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know anything about computers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why you're so perfect.  You have something I don't have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An eye -- for performance.  You know the truth when you see it.  I know.  I've seen your movies.  I love your movies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Straw God" changed my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen every frame of your work.  You're the only filmmaker in Hollywood with the artistic integrity to realize my vision.  You and me, art and science... we are the perfect marriage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Hank, it's been a rough day. (climbing into his car) I'll call you about his next week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at the car window) I won't be here next week.  The tumor's inoperable.  I'll be dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (winding down the window) I'm already dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor's car roars away.  He looks back at the forlorn Ha in the rear view mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me. (looking at his watch) This week!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge eye from a dismantled Nicola Anders billboard is wheeled away behind him -- followed by a huge pair of lip

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sea of ingenue headshots.  Black X's are drawn through of them.  VIKTOR lies amongst the rejected faces, talking the telephone, in his spartan bachelor beach house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone, referring to a young woman's headshot) -- What do you mean she won't work with me?  She's done nothing.  She doesn't have a single credit --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from phone, off-camera) -- Better no credits than a Taransky credit.  No young actress is going to step into Nicola Anders' shoes and risk ending her career before it's even started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Art, you don't understand.  I've mortgaged everything to finish this film -- creditors calling, coming to the house, for God's sake, I need this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone goes dead.  Viktor tries to re-dial -- disconnected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Damn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sharp knock on his door.  Viktor peers through a curtain spies an official-looking MAN IN A SUIT, carrying what lo to be a legal notice in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor slips out of the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR hurries along the beach.  When he turns, he discov the MAN IN THE SUIT following him.  As Viktor runs, the S runs -- calling out to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Taransky, Mr. Taransky --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling back) I'm not him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor stumbles.  When he recovers, the Suit is on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Taransky, Sir, I represent the estate of Mr. Hank Aleno. (showing him Hank's obituary in the L.A.  Times) It was Mr. Aleno's last wish that you have this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Suit hands Viktor a heavily-sealed envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea, Sir.  He wanted you to have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Suit departs.  Viktor hesitates, then breaks the seal the package -- inside he finds a hard-drive.  The hard-dr is labeled "SIMULATION ONE".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a VACUUM CLEANER cleaning a tatty red carpet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the other end of the vacuum cleaner is VIKTOR.  The re carpet leads to a rundown, downtown Los Angeles cinema -- venue for the premiere of "SUNRISE, SUNSET".  To save mon on posters, Viktor has altered the originals, "Starring NICOLA ANDERS" crudely pasted over with "Introducing SIMO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR regards the sad, little premiere.  No paparazzi, n limos, no klieg lights.  Resorting to giving away tickets PASSERS-BY, Viktor approaches a HOMELESS MAN sleeping in trash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to see a free movie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he thinks) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A taxi pulls up.  Viktor's daughter, LAINEY, steps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kissing him hello) Hi, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Lainey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor goes to pay for the taxi but doesn't have quite en cash.  Lainey pays herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother couldn't make it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's at the premiere of "A Cold Day In Hell".  But I think she send someone from Acquisitions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She still with Kent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This week anyhow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR escorts Lainey down the empty red carpet, regardin the pathetic premiere.  As they walk by, the bulb in Vikt sole spotlight expires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not quite how I imagined it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking on the bright side) -- You finished the film on your own terms, that's what matters.  Did you really do all the post yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was no other way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I missed you.  I wondered if you were ever coming back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (regarding the makeshift poster, trying to lift his spirits) Well, I can't wait to meet Simone... what's her last name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I... don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she here tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can't watch herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are interrupted by the THEATER OWNER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Hey, we have to start.  I've got "Tough Love 2" playing at ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A foggy, empty pier.  A MAN is running through the mist, shouting desperately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valarie!  VALARIE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, out of the fog -- a young woman in a black cape hood, her back to us.  The camera pushes in, music swells she turns.  SIMONE.  She is exquisitely, ethereally beautiful.  Perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the near-empty, dilapidated theater, "SUNRISE, SUNSET" playing ON THE SCREEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Simone's face appears, the faces of the AUDIENCE MEM change.  They are all visibly moved, including the THEATE OWNER.  Some weeping, some with curious smiles on their faces, some opened-mouthed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ON SCREEN, approaching) Valarie, what are you running from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enigmatic smile) From Valarie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly a GUNSHOT rings out.  Simone collapses to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (running to her) Valarie!  No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR, unable to watch, paces up and down, chain-smoking while worriedly shoving popcorn in his mouth.  Viktor fin musters the courage to look inside the auditorium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same scene that played in the studio screening room.  However now when we cut from the leading man, HAL, to the leading lady it is not NICOLA but the newly cast SIMONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Why are we here?  Is that what you're asking, Jack?... Why are we here?  No why.  Just here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SCREEN SIMONE lies dying.  Now even LAINEY is affected Simone's performance.  She wipes a tear from her eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR watches the backs of the heads, trying to gauge th audience reaction.  Finally the credits roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dedication, "For HANK".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one moves from their seats.  Viktor permits himself a brief smile of satisfaction as he sees his name appear in credits:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Film By VIKTOR TARANSKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still no one moves from their seats.  Viktor cannot stand any longer.  He runs to the restroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Face over the stained sink, VIKTOR splashes himself with water.  He looks to the mirror, horrified by his own reflection.  He rehearses a courtroom speech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen of the jury, I may be guilty of a crime, but it was committed with the purest of intentions, to send a message to the acting community who put themselves above the work and above --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three AUDIENCE MEMBERS enter the restroom.  They approach urinals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing their conversation from the lobby) -- So fake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Totally artificial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor looks at the men aghast and hurriedly exits, missi the end of their conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're really supposed to believe that was 19th Century Lisbon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's looking at the sets when she is on the screen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All three nod in agreement and begin to urinate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR exits the restroom.  Almost all the AUDIENCE MEMBE including LAINEY, are waiting for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing out her father) There he is.  That's my dad, Viktor Taransky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor is about to run for the exit when the small group spontaneously applauds.  They rush to shake his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- She is magnificent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Absolutely unreal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor appears uncomfortable with their compliments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wasn't too... cartoony?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Who?  The nun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Or are you talking about the mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- A star like that, who cares about the supporting cast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Congratulations again.  She was... not of this earth.  You should be very proud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Not of this earth".  A good way of putting it.  And the film as a whole -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group drifts away, leaving LAINEY and VIKTOR alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a miracle, Dad.  Where did you find her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (vague) I saw her picture on the, er... internet. (interrogating his daughter's face) You really didn't notice anything -- unusual?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only her brilliance.  To be honest, with what you had to work with, I was expecting a train wreck.  You really pulled it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lainey regards the makeshift poster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a feeling mom is going to take you back after this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor's head snaps around.  Lainey smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back on the lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor shrugs off the misunderstanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR enters his sterile, bachelor home, carrying his ma His answering machine blinks in the darkness, the message light reads "FULL".  He hits the "PLAY" button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor, you bastard!  I hear it's great. (beat) Seriously, I'm happy for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor opens a drawer containing a photo of he and Elaine from happier times.  He gazes at it as he listens to the message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know people are going to be beating down your door but... well, I'd love the chance to buy back something I gave away for free.  Don't you just love Hollywood?... BEEP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor stops the machine, dazed.  He idly opens his mail. Inside an envelope he finds a SAG Card with the new membe name, "SIMONE".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A)  A line of AUDIENCE MEMBERS stretches outside the rund movie theater as far as the eye can see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dazzling new ingenue has come from seemingly nowhere to capture the hearts of movie-going audiences across the nation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B)  THE FRONT PAGE OF "VARIETY" coming off the presses re "SIMONE: A REVELATION -- Dawning Of A New Star In "SUNRISE".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... in her debut film, "Sunrise, Sunset".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C)  A TEENAGE BOY in a public library logs on to the firs website dedicated to SIMONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her face is already posted on everything from websites to bedroom walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D)  Trendy TEENAGE GIRLS saunter past a swimming pool in Simone capes and hoods despite the sweltering heat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her wardrobe has inspired a fashion craze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: E)  In a Third World back-alley a YOUNG ASIAN MAN shows a UNDERCOVER REPORTER a pirated recording of SIMONE on a camcorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And bootleg copies of her film are being sold in back alleys all over the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: F)  A LIQUOR STORE CUSTOMER watches a TV behind the count showing a clip of SIMONE from, "SUNRISE, SUNSET Courtesy: Taransky Productions".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from TV) But who is Simone?  We know so little about her.  No details of her background have been released, not even her age.  She is somewhere between a girl and a woman.  A fresh face and familiar both at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: G)  The ENTERTAINMENT REPORTER now stands outside a multiplex.  The marquee has 16 screens and looks like this:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Simone even her real name?  And why the secrecy?  All we know for sure is that she was discovered by little-known director, Viktor Tarinsky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR, watching "SCENE" on a TV in the back of a limousi corrects the reporter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taransky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the TV) He has parlayed his relationship with the new sensation into a three picture deal with the very studio that dumped him only six months ago.  And no wonder with the starlet's performance breaking all box office records.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the studio entrance, a swarm of REPORTERS, PHOTOGRAPHERS and FANS rush VIKTOR's limousine, hoping fo glimpse of SIMONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simone!  SIMONE!  I LOVE YOU!  I Want to BE you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Studio SECURITY GUARDS hold them back as the limo enters lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE and an entourage of EXECUTIVES greets VIKTOR's limousine on the studio steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A STUDIO PHOTOGRAPHER has a camera at the ready.  A banne reads, "Welcome SIMONE".  A YOUNG ASSISTANT wheels a cake

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR steps out of the car.  ELAINE pushes past him, int the limo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simone!... Simone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re-emerging from the car) Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to see you too, Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring his sarcasm) Why isn't she with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?  Because she would never show up at something like this.  She's intensely private.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine sighs, exasperated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dismissing her colleagues) Back to work, everyone.  She's not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reception committee disperses, murmurs of disappointm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor... I want to thank you for convincing Simone to sign with the studio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't thank me.  It was entirely Simone's decision.  Do you have Simone's check?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have it on me.  Anyway, it means a lot. (quickly changing tack) Have you read the reviews?  They're love letters. (reading from a newspaper) Listen to this one.  "Simone has the voice of a young Jane Fonda, the body of Sophia Loren, the grace of, well, Grace Kelley, and the face of Audrey Hepburn combined with an angel".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (musing to himself) Almost right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't wait to meet her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if that's going to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As I say, she's... something of a recluse.  That's how she's able to stay so pure -- by isolating herself in her art.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (face falling) Don't be ridiculous.  I arranged a press conference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the question.  A circus like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor, it's my studio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's my actor.  There are other studios, Elaine.  There's only one Simone. (leaving her on the steps) Leave the press conference to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor strides up the studio steps.  Elaine stares after ex-husband -- she finds herself smiling at his newfound arrogance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The studio soundstages as a backdrop, VIKTOR approaches a podium and a forest of microphones, revelling in his rece fame by association.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tapping the microphone) Is this on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taransky, Viktor.  T-a-r-a-n-s-k-y, V-i-k-t-o-r.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but -- who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (patronizing smile) I am a two-time Academy Award nominated director with over eighteen films to my credit thus far including my latest release, "Sunrise, Sunset".  Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A REPORTER rolls her eyes at his pomposity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will not be taking any questions.  However I do have a statement to read on behalf of my leading lady, Simone. (reading from his statement) "To Whom It May Concern.  I'm deeply grateful for the extraordinary public response to Mr. Taransky's film.  At this time I will be conducting no interviews or making publicity appearances since I am really nothing without the beautiful worlds and characters Mr. Taransky creates for me.  I politely request that the press respect my privacy and let the work speak for itself.  All questions and inquiries should be directed to Mr. Taransky to whom I entrust all aspects of my career.  Yours very truly, Simone".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reporters all call out at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Viktor, Viktor, who's Simone dating?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Viktor, where'd you find her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Is Simone her real name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- What's she got to hide?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Is she the new Garbo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Who's Garbo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor silences the reporters by theatrically raising his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I made it clear -- no questions regarding Simone. (bringing the press conference to a hasty conclusion) Now, I would like to close by announcing that Miss Simone begins production today on her next film, "Eternity Forever".  This project has been near and dear to my heart since I wrote it nine years ago. (a tinge of bitterness, then a smile) I Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor exits the podium.  A voice stops him in his tracks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do you think you're fooling, Taransky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor turns.  The voice belongs to over-zealous, crusadi truth-seeking investigative reporter, MAX SAYER, accompan by his assistant, MILTON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I know you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max Sayer -- National Echo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (regaining his composure, a smirk) Don't you have a real story to write?  Why aren't you in Latin America?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember when the Echo had class  -- the paper that could bring down governments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our leaders aren't presidents anymore -- they're pop stars and screen idols.  If Woodward and Bernstein were alive today, they'd be right here in Hollywood with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are alive, Sayer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton confirms that Woodward and Bernstein are still liv

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So they're probably here. (hardly missing a beat) You might be able to sell this 'disappearing act' to the rest of the world, but I'm not buying it.  What's really behind this Simone woman?  The public has a right to know.  Why is she staying out of sight?  And why the hell is she with you?  I don't want you to take this the wrong way, Viktor, but you're not exactly Cecil B.  DeMille -- more run-of-the-mill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe the reason she's with me is a little thing called integrity, Sayer.  Look it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling after him) Oh, I know all about integrity.  I know even more about persistence.  Look that one up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max watches Viktor depart, with obvious suspicion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large satellite dish sits atop a soundstage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "CLOSED SET" is the sign on the door -- a surveillance ca panning the entrance.  A SECURITY GUARD, also keeping wat nods a greeting to VIKTOR as he pulls up in his studio go cart, script in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one came in or went out just like you said, Mr. Taransky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Miss Simone coming today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's already here.  She arrived before you and she'll leave long after you've gone. (admonishing guard) Remember, under no circumstances are you or any other person to enter the set without my express permission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if it catches on fire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let it burn.  Simone would rather go up in flames than give up her privacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor enters his secret code into the keypad lock and en the soundstage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cavernous soundstage is almost completely empty save a small table upon which sits two computer keyboards and tablet attached to a large, projection screen monitor and side monitors.  VIKTOR takes a seat in front of the monit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself as he inserts his Hollywood hard-drive

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pay no attention to the man behind the computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A title appears on his computer screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a satisfied smile, Viktor backspaces characters unti revises the title to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He presses "ENTER" and a face begins to build -- wire upo wire, pixel upon pixel -- until a completed synthespian emerges -- SIMONE.  She is indistinguishable from a flesh blood actress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simone moves on a video loop against a neutral background titled "VISUAL LOOP 6".  Within the confines of the monit she is reminiscent of a beautiful caged animal.  She look little bored as if she has been cooped up in cyberspace f too long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the screen) Good morning, Simone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Mr. Taransky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A star is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... digitized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only now do we observe that Viktor is occasionally talkin into a microphone connected to the computer and pressing key on his keyboard.  When he speaks, she speaks.  Simone voice and mouth movements automatically sync in response Viktor's voice.  A scanning light on Viktor allows Simone mimic his movements.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean they buy it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous smile as he examines his first royalty check) Buy it?  They're paying for it.  And around here that's how you really know they buy it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor fondly touches a photograph of Hank that is taped the terminal -- from the "L.A. Times" obituaries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm only sorry Hank isn't here to see this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor looks up, Simone mimicking his action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (depressing the button every time he wants to express his thoughts through Simone) Maybe he can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any idea what this means, Simone?  Our ability to manufacture fraud now exceeds our ability to detect it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (appearing to indulge Viktor with a smile) I am the death of real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pondering the enormity of the hoax) You are birth of... what?  A Phenomenon.  A miracle.  A new era in show business.  All I wanted to do was finish the film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now look what you've started.  And now look what you've started.  And now look what you've started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor's conversation with himself is not merely for his amusement.  He is adjusting and refining Simone's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm... a little less Streep, a little more Bacall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor scrolls through a photo library of stars, living a dead, that comprise Simone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor makes an adjustment on a panel on the computer scr dedicated to Simone's audio, incorporating the vocal deliveries -- "20% STREEP, 80% BACALL".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He speaks once again as Simone to test the adjustment.  T voice patterns appear on his screen -- graphic representations of the sound waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that better, Mr. Taransky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Yes, it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR snaps back to reality himself.  He scrolls through list of screen legends.  He clicks on the image of AUDREY HEPBURN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While I think of it, I'd like you to add something to your repertoire -- remember that thing Hepburn does in "Breakfast At Tiffany's".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A clip of AUDREY HEPBURN in "Breakfast At Tiffany's" play the screen.  Hepburn, sitting on a fire escape, looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the screen, an incomparable smile) Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pausing the moment) Let's hear you say "Hi" like Audrey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a CUT and PASTE, Viktor morphs the gesture seamlessl into a frozen Simone.  Viktor presses play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (imitating Audrey's performance perfectly) Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect. (stretching) God, I'm so relaxed around you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did create me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I... just helped bring someone else's dream to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Taransky, we both know I was nothing without you.  I was computer code -- ones and zeros.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right.  You're right.  Of course, one doesn't want to boast.  It's a classic case of technology in search of an artist.  That's all you've been waiting for, an artist with integrity, with a vision, who can see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor gets up and starts walking around the room, warmin his theme.  SIMONE moves in a VISUAL LOOP on the monitor, nodding attentively as if she's really interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See beyond that irrational allegiance to flesh and blood. -- See that with the rise in price of a real actor and the fall in price of a fake, the scales have tipped in favor of the fake. (voice raising in excitement) -- See that if the performance is genuine, it doesn't matter if the actor is real.  Once a performance is committed to film, the blood and bones are gone anyway.  Only the spirit, the illusion remains.  Besides, what's real anymore?  These days most actors have digital work done to them so it's a gray area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Simone appears to look directly at her maker) Are you ever going to tell the truth about me, Mr. Taransky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only real truth is in the work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I'm talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Yes, I'm going to tell the truth about you, why wouldn't I...? (pondering his own question) Of course, with Hank's tragic passing, the secret died with him. (shaking the thought from his head) I am going to tell the truth... after your next picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feeling uneasy at the prospect, Viktor changes the subjec He pulls out his script for "ETERNITY FOREVER".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speaking of which -- this is the project I'd like you to do next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not, "Eternity Forever"?  The legendary unproduced script that was too good ever to get made?  I'd kill for that part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was hoping you'd say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Simone appears to talk on her own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do anything to please you, Mr. Taransky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pretending to be hard of hearing) I'm sorry, I didn't catch that.  What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do anything to please you, Mr. Taransky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a side monitor, we discover a highlighted box marked " RECORD" -- Viktor's finger on the "PLAY" button.  He is unable to resist speaking another line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I will never, ever leave you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simone appears to indulge Viktor by blowing him a kiss -- until we see that Viktor has now highlighted a box marked

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor comes close to the monitor.  He notices something about Simone's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so beautiful.  Too beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor accesses a program labeled, "DISTINGUISHING FEATUR He adds a "FRECKLE" and a "MOLE".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a distance we watch him, alone with Simone in the va empty soundstage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR's face against the SKY.  As he walks, we reveal th the sky is no more than a huge, painted backdrop on the studio lot -- behind a parking lot.  Viktor hands his val ticket to a fawning VALET MANAGER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Just be a minute, Mr. Taransky.  We gave you a complimentary car wash -- they're washing the engine now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor joins other industry MOVERS and SHAKERS waiting fo their cars under an umbrella.  A young TALENT AGENT approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor!  Look, I'm sorry I didn't call you back last year.  I was, er... out of the country. (strained moment) But we should get together.  My schedule's wide open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, I'll... "call you".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The agent's face falls.  He gets in his car, disconsolate

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, HAL SINCLAIR, rushes over and hugs Viktor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor, I'm so happy for us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Hal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The film.  The chemistry.  No reflections on Nicola but Simone and I -- we were just so right together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never were together, Hal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And still the connection was undeniable. (aside) I haven't read "Eternity Forever" but I know it's brilliant.  And I know I would be perfect for Clive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (correcting him) Clyde.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, perfect. (lowering his voice) As a matter of fact, I ran into Simone on the lot the other day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (genuinely startled) Really?  She didn't mention it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly covering) I'm sure she's meeting with a lot of people right now. (under his breath) She is just as you described her, Viktor... indescribable.  I strongly sensed she thought I was right for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind his back, Viktor surreptitiously presses a button his cell phone.  The phone rings.  Viktor feigns surprise answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (answering the phone he has just dialed, louder than necessary) Hello?... SIMONE!  How are you, sweetheart?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hush descends over the executives.  Hal is suddenly ver uncomfortable.  Even the VALETS strain to eavesdrop on th conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (winking to Hal) You'll never guess who I'm with... you ran into him on the lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was more in passing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so far off! (finally chuckles) Hal... Hal Sinclair... your co- star.  Remember now?... No, I don't think he's put on weight. (a shrug of apology to the appalled Hal) Anyway, you think he's right for "Eternity Forever"?... not the right type?... a different direction... (covering phone, to Hal) I'll try to talk her into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other INDUSTRY PEOPLE make a note of the remark.  A mortified Hal excuses himself with a pathetic wave, climb into his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) ... Listen this is a bad place to talk... what?... sweetheart, I know you have charity work you want to do, I know you want to give back -- but remember, your greatest gift is your talent... we'll talk about it at the beach house this weekend... I'm looking forward to it too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor hangs up.  His car pulls up.  He tips extravagantl and drives away.  The INDUSTRY PEOPLE get on their cell phones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parked behind the sky facade is a curious CAR with shaded windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the car, MAX SAYER and assistant MILTON, scanner i hand, are replaying Viktor's intercepted phone call on a computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the machine) -- "... You think he's right for "Eternity Forever"?... not the right type?... a different direction..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Max, a shake of the head) I'm getting nothing from her side of the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it a jamming device?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Maybe he's talking to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dismissing the idea) Taransky isn't that good an actor.  No, they're taking special precautions.  Some kind of new encryption.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (musing) Whatever it is, it's dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, very.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue listening to the recording.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "... We'll talk about it at the beach house this weekend..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAX's eyes light up.  He gazes to a photo of SIMONE paste the inside of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR and LAINEY make breakfast.  Lainey is in her pajam occasionally glancing to a laptop computer as her father prepares French toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glancing to the computer) Can't you stop that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those things can be dangerous.  Staring at a screen all day -- you miss what's going on outside in the real world.  You can lose yourself.  You should get out more.  How are you going to meet boys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs coyly, getting up) I know plenty of boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?  Who?  Where do you meet them?  In a chat room?  How do you know he's not some middle-aged freak?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, I can spot a middle-aged freak a mile away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  But you have to find a way to escape that thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do?  Still?  I can't tell you how happy I am to hear that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were the one who insisted on it.  Reading me Dostoyevsky and Joyce when I was four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You understood them.  That's what was amazing. (looking out the window) It's a nice day.  Let's eat outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lainey grabs the plates and opens the deck door.  We hear chorus of CLICKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, it may be nicer inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor joins her at the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay here, I'll deal with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unfazed, Lainey retreats into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boats are moored just off the beach packed dangerously fu of telephoto lens-toting PHOTOGRAPHERS.  The next door ho have LENSES protruding through the drapes of the windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR strides onto the lawn of his property that backs o the beach, soaking up the attention -- unable to resist waving extravagantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a PHOTOGRAPHER, losing his balance, drops from nearby rooftop.  The photographer limps towards the fence Viktor calmly follows, retrieving the photographer's came and ripping out the film with a flourish -- he is clearly relishing the attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The photographer clambers over the fence where he joins several dozen other SHUTTER-BUGS and VIDEORAZZI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wasn't her, Taransky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she?  You can't hide her forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hurling the camera into the mob) You'll never find her.  Simone only appears when I want her to appear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAX SAYER from "The NATIONAL ECHO" is at the head of the accompanied by assistant MILTON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sounds like a prisoner, Taransky.  Are you holding her hostage?  Are you some kind of Svengali?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recognizing the reporter) Who's the hostage, Sayer, her or you?  You look kind of "captive" yourself.  While you're spending every waking hour obsessing over Simone, guess what, I guarantee she doesn't even know you exist.  Get off my property or I'll call the cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops?  The cops read my column to know who to bust.  We're the only watchdog the public has. (looking around at the photographers) None of this is going away.  We'll be here tomorrow and the day after that.  Until you slip up.  And you will.  You are looking at your shadow. (getting in his face) Because all these elaborate precautions with Simone -- every instinct in my body tells me, it's not natural.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just trying to help you, Sayer.  I don't want you to be disappointed.  It gets cold out here at night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice try.  If we can't get to her through you, maybe your family will be more co-operative.  I can guarantee you, Taransky, one way or another, Miss Simone and I are going to get acquainted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning away) I'd like to see that, Sayer.  Invite me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR drives along a twisty mountain road, LAINEY in the passenger seat.  They have become so blase about the paparazzi, they no longer acknowledge the posse of motorc PHOTOGRAPHERS risking their necks to stay up with the car

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- The rumor is, Simone is holed up in Taransky's Malibu home -- so far we haven't seen so much as a glimpse --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (switching off the radio) Honey, I'm really sorry about all this.  I don't know if it's safe for you to stay the weekends... just until things settle down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Okay, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If anyone asks about Simone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I know, I don't know anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. (slightly irritated by her lack of interest) Don't you wonder where I'm really hiding Simone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking to him) I'm sure you'd tell me if you thought it was important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lainey gives her father a smile.  Through the car window behind her, a MOTORCYCLIST appears to lose control and dr down a bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR'S car pulls up to Elaine's imposing mansion.  LAIN gives her father a kiss and departs.  ELAINE, in the gard overseeing a GARDENER pruning roses, approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the car) Sorry I didn't get her back in time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem. (she smiles) Do you want to come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised -- pleasantly) Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR walks down a hall, passing the dining room, where is working on a computer.  Kent smiles blandly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Vik.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disappointed to see him) Hello -- Kent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR waits in an opulent drawing room.  Despite the eig degree temperature outside, a fire burns in the hearth.  ELAINE enters, waving a thick studio file.  Viktor's face falls, expecting a less business-related conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor, we simply have to talk about "Eternity..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Forever".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever.  I still haven't received Simone's script notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There aren't any.  If the filmmakers are happy, Simone's happy.  She considers herself an... "instrument".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?  Oh, so she's really going to do all this nudity?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) If it's on the page...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine refers to her documents, bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, something has to be done about this budget.  It's completely unrealistic. (referring to a column in the budget) You allowed nothing for limousine service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll drive herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hair and make-up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll do her own.  Theater training.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was in the theater?  When?  Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll send you her resume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Al least a contingency for wardrobe.  Any woman can go up a dress size.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I guarantee she won't gain an once.  She's very disciplined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned by an entry in the budget) Well, we have to do something about this -- "stuntwoman".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There isn't one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No need.  She does all her own stunts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (skeptical) Even the fall from the plane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nonchalant) Even the fall from the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, shoot it on the last day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor regards Elaine with a condescending look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As I've tried to explain to you, Elaine.  Simone isn't like any other actress you've ever known.  She's about the work and only the work -- lives for the work.  She wants all the money up there... (gazing into space) ... on the screen where it belongs.  She'd work for scale except I know you only respect people you pay a fortune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which accounts for your percentage. (tossing the budget on the coffee table) When do I get to meet this dream?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not today.  She's learning her lines. (glancing to Elaine's budget) You can also take cue cards and teleprompter out of the budget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) I'll walk you out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine escorts Viktor out to the lavish garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE's demeanor softens.  She speaks to VIKTOR quietly, sympathetically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Viktor... I want to talk to you now, not as Elaine, studio head, but Elaine, ex-wife. (correcting herself) Second ex-wife.  You got lucky this last time but you need to be careful.  We both know you wouldn't be making this overblown art film of you hadn't convinced Simone to be in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine, talking to you now, not as Viktor, director, but Viktor, ex husband... what the hell happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exasperated) Experience, Viktor.  I've seen this a hundred times -- young stars destroying the very people who discovered them.  I'm worried about you, that's all.  This woman -- she controls your destiny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simone does not control my destiny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor, I have a feeling.  One of my feelings.  There's something about her I don't trust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From her bedroom window on the mansion's second floor, LA smiles at the sight of her mother and father together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT.  SIMONE & VIKTOR'S OFFICE - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR enters his office where he's greeted by his assist JANE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sheepish) Thanks for taking me back, Mr. Taransky.  I know it looked like I sided with the studio, but I always believed in you, honestly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry.  I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (referring to the cast seated around a conference table) They're all here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT.  SIMONE & VIKTOR'S OFFICE - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR sits at the head of the table, surrounded by HAL, LOTUS, MAC and three other CAST MEMBERS.  A preliminary poster behind him -- "COMING THIS SUMMER - SIMONE in ETER FOREVER" -- bears a huge photograph of Simone's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell you how delighted I am to have this wonderful cast assembled for "Eternity Forever".  Thank you all.  Now, a reminder -- as a condition for working on this film, you will not be rehearsing with Simone, shooting with Simone and you are forbidden from contacting Simone in any way at any time, whatsoever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAST nods seriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a thought occurs) How will you do our love scenes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Body double.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) For her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For you. (addressing the entire cast) I want you to know, Simone appreciates you all working for scale.  But why am I thanking you?  Simone can thank you herself.  She insisted on speaking with you before filming begins.  She's on the line now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor nods to a speaker phone in the center of the table red blinking light on the phone.  The cast reacts excited

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pushing a button on the phone) Simone, are you there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through the speakerphone) I certainly am, Mr. Taransky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unable to contain her excitement) So are we, Simone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone laughs giddily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you leave me alone with my co-stars, Mr. Taransky, so we can get to know each other better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.  I'll be back in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.  Who's there?  Don't be shy.  Introduce yourselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAST stares nervously at the speakerphone.  Mac break the silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Mac.  I turned down a Bertolucci film to be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name's Lotus.  God, I can't believe I'm talking to you.  We're going to become such great friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Hal.  Wonderful to be working together... again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other cast members introduce themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR pulls up sharply in his studio golf cart outside t nearby soundstage and hurriedly enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR races across the vast, empty space to a digital player, connected to a phone.  Simone's pre-recorded open remarks (graphically represented on the screen) are almos completed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that everyone...? (pause) Well, obviously, as you know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor jumps into the conversation in the nick of time, speaking through the synthesizer.  As usual, Viktor's voi is automatically synthesized into the voice of Simone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I'm Simone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other CAST MEMBERS laugh nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from Viktor's speakerphone) Obviously.  Who else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from speaker phone) I just want to start by apologizing for my "process" --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT.  SIMONE & VIKTOR'S OFFICE - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAST are hunched over the speakerphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- No.  No.  I'm completely simpatico.  On my last film I was playing a schizophrenic so I made them give me two dressing rooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (an aside) So committed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well thank you for your understanding.  I know it's an unusual way to work but I just find I relate better to people when they're not actually there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have much to say except that I know it's going to be a great project, if we all just trust Mr. Taransky's vision.  Always do what Mr. Taransky says.  If in doubt, do it the Taransky way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all nod vigorously in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know we're going to make a wonderful movie together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding in agreement) Wonderful movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Together, absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR removes his own garbage from his soundstage.  A yo cleaning woman, VIVIAN, wheeling a janitor's cart, tentatively approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Taransky...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (referring to the stage) No one goes in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian hesitantly hands Viktor a publicity photo of SIMON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's not too much trouble.  Could you...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitant about broaching the subject) This last year I was... going through some things. (shaking her head at the memory) Awful, awful... things.  But when I saw Simone in "Sunrise"... what she did... in the scene in the fireworks factory... (face lighting up) ... suddenly everything made sense.  My friends, family, doctors -- nobody could reach me -- but Simone, she really... spoke to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor is touched by the heartfelt testimony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll be happy to sign it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A green set.  Walls, floor, ceiling -- all green.  A FULL CAST shoots HAL, dressed in a futuristic suit, tentativel crossing the green expanse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
