dialogues.text: Hal pauses, looks longingly, then impulsively dashes forw Hal passionately embraces thin air and wrestles it to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut!  Cut!... Cut!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal freezes.  VIKTOR runs from behind the camera and confronts Hal on the green floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor, Clyde simply has to get close to Simone in this scene!  He has to touch her.  He has to!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she's right there!  I must feel her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggling to find an excuse) There's... a wall between you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- an emotional wall, I know.  That's why --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- No.  No.  A real wall. (describing a wall with his hands within the green space) You ran right through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) How did the wall get there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't explain it to you now -- you'll see when it's all put together. (walking away) Anyway, we got it a couple of takes ago.  Let's move on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal, dumbfounded, tentatively touches the non-existent wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor digitally adds SIMONE standing beside a sportscar HAL in a scene from "Eternity Forever".  He works on her close up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes welling with tears) -- What you don't understand, Clyde, is that love is like a wild flower, but that flower only grows --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor hits STOP and Simone freezes.  Viktor brings up a and chooses from a range of "EMOTIONAL OPTIONS".

dialogues.speaker: JOY SADNESS FEAR
dialogues.text: elated               melancholy           anxious jubilant             tearful              frightened giddy                weeping              petrified ecstatic             blubbering           loss of bladder inebriated           Kevorkian              control

dialogues.speaker: CONTEMPLATION INNOCENCE SENSUALITY
dialogues.text: reflective           chaste               seductive thoughtful           virtuous             lustful meditative           angelic              bestial stoic                Madonna              Madonna bored out of her      [Blessed Virgin]     [Like A Virgin skull

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fine-tunes SIMONE's performance -- sliding a cursor on performance axis from "BROAD" to "SUBTLE".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's take it down a notch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- What you don't understand --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simone freezes again.  Viktor make another adjustment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like it.  But still too big. (making a correction) Smaller teardrops next time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simone's tears retreat into her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not working.  It's not alive.  Let's try it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She repeats the line.  Viktor mimes the performance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (teardrops arriving on cue) -- What you don't understand, Clyde, is that love is like a wild flower, but that flower only grows on the edge... (dramatic pause) ... of a very high cliff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simone FREEZES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect, Simone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor returns SIMONE to her neutral background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm only sorry you still have to work with flesh and blood for the time being -- as user friendly as you are, even I can't manufacture an entire cast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "To Vivian.  Love, Simone" -- VIKTOR writes on the public shot.  He applies lipstick and adds a kiss to the photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor wipes his mouth and looks to SIMONE on his screen she is waiting patiently, as usual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are going to have to change our plans, Simone -- you have no idea what an affect your performance is having on people.  We can't stop now.  There's too much to say -- these films they speak, they speak to the human condition.  We're changing lives.  No, revealing the truth now would be too cruel. (searching for more justification) Anyway, when you're seeking a greater truth -- in the work -- you are not so concerned with the lesser truths along the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simone doesn't appear convinced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to get in a lot of trouble, Mr. Taransky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritated at her pricking his conscience) Why do you have to bring that up?  There's always risk -- life's a risk.  It's worth it.  Besides, how could something so lovely be a crime? (regarding her tenderly) Well, I think we've done enough for today.  You've been cooped up in there too long.  How about you and me go out on the town?  They're expecting us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to a copy of "The Echo".  A photo of Viktor at t gate of his Malibu home.  "SIMONE HELD CAPTIVE - Self proclaimed Svengali Keeps Star Out Of Limelight".  Viktor puts Simone to sleep and picks up a briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR, briefcase in hand, strides through the lobby of a opulent hotel.  He approached the CONCIERGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm checking in a special guest... (obviously conspiratorial) ... Miss Enomis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Concierge straightens as he recognizes Viktor from a of "Variety".  Headline: "Taransky Rides Ingenue's Coat-T To Three Picture Deal".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Enomis, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Enomis demands her privacy.  You will switch off all surveillance cameras.  I will escort Miss Enomis to her room alone via the rear exit.  She will require no help with her luggage.  She does not wish to be disturbed at any time for any reason.  She will be departing for a function tonight at eight sharp. (tipping him with a hundred dollar bill) I'm sure I can rely on your discretion.  Do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (passing the key to Viktor) Oh, I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Viktor departs, the Concierge holds the registration c to the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ENOMIS becomes SIMONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Concierge picks up his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR enters the hotel suite.  We see a montage of scene Viktor revelling in his masquerade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A)  VIKTOR pulls down the covers of a bed and rolls aroun the sheets to give it a slept-in look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B)  VIKTOR sprays cologne in the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C)  VIKTOR tosses skimpy lingerie on the floor of the clo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D)  VIKTOR eats several candy bars from the mini-bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: E)  VIKTOR puts one of his own movies in the DVD player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: F)  VIKTOR writes a note on the bedside pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: G)  In the bathroom, shower running, VIKTOR attempts to o a tampon -- it shoots out of the applicator like a penny rocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: H)  VIKTOR cuts a lock of "faux" hair from a Simone wig a scatters it on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I)  VIKTOR shakes open a bag of toiletries, the toothbrus bouncing into the toilet bowl.  He retrieves it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J)  VIKTOR looks through the drapes of the hotel window - jam of PRESS PHOTOGRAPHERS has congregated outside the rear entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: K)  VIKTOR shines a lamp against a doll casting a life-si shadow on the drapes.  A "walking" silhouette is visible to the media on the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: L)  VIKTOR writes a message in lipstick on the mirror -- LOVE YOU V--".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR is interrupted by a knock on the door.  He looks a his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (peering through the peephole) Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from other side of door) It's... Simone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR stands at the rear entrance of the hotel with a le YOUNG WOMAN wearing a coat over her head.  A HOTEL DOORMA keeps back the growing horde of REPORTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor's limousine waits at the curb.  The coated woman starts towards the car but Viktor holds her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet. (scrutinizing the crowd) Where's "Matinee"?  There they are.  Okay, I think everyone's here.  Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor and the young woman run the gauntlet to the car, providing a perfect albeit restricted photo-op for the paparazzi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over here, sweetheart!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come one Simone, take it off, baby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got a job to do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car door slams shut as the pack descends.  MAX SAYER MILTON are amongst the frustrated reporters.  The limo screeches away.  A POLICE MOTORCYCLIST prevents anyone following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The frustrated REPORTERS assess their efforts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I got a piece of her ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't get shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emerging from the pack, to Max) Ten feet from a living Goddess...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAX SAYER pays off the CONCIERGE.  His assistant, MILTON, begins to collect "evidence" of the celebrity -- dusting fingerprints, etc.  Max rubs pencil into the impression o the bedside notepad revealing the message -- "The meaning life is that it ends".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting Milton's work) Leave me for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton and the Concierge depart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max is alone.  He looks around the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A)  MAX enters the bathroom.  He picks up a drinking glas and inspects it closely before placing it in a sealed plastic bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B)  MAX examines the wet soap from the shower and also pl it in a plastic bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C)  MAX picks up the used toothbrush, puts it to his lips before placing it in a plastic bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D)  MAX gently places his hands on the toilet seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: E)  MAX enters the bedroom.  He carefully removes a slip a pillow.  He folds it meticulously, appearing to breathe in its scent as he places it in a plastic bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: F)  Finally, MAX kneels and gazes at "Simone's" unmade be He slowly slides into the bed and slips beneath the same sheets recently vacated by Viktor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILTON, ear pressed against the door, tries to listen ins

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR and the COATED WOMAN have finally left the PAPARAZ in their wake.  Viktor gently removes the coat from over head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although the woman is impossible beautiful, she is not Simone.  FAITH is Simone's latest stand-in and decoy.  Vi and Faith are still pressed together against one side of limousine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not quite able to avert his eyes from her telescopic legs) Thank God for you, Faith.  I know this is above and beyond the call of duty for a stand-in.  You don't know what a service you're performing for Simone -- shielding her from those animals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thank God for you, Mr. Taransky.  How many men would go to so much trouble to protect a woman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither Viktor nor Faith seem inclined to move from their intimate position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You understand you'll have to come back to my place to keep them off the, er... (his nose close to Faith's neck) ... scent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (meeting her gaze) You look so, so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... so much like her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, of course, but very beautiful in your own right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do find myself physically attracted to you, Mr. Taransky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their lips are now tantalizingly close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR'S HEAD hits the sofa in his living room, closely followed by FAITH on top of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith tears at his clothes and her own, ravenous.  Viktor hardly resists.  In the midst of the wild caresses, Faith murmurs in his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do whatever you do to Simone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?... What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what you do to Simone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I do to Simone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, call me Simone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still tearing at his clothes) Yes, yes, again, again.  Do what you do to Simone.  I want to know what it's like to be her just for one night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) You're with me to be close to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panting) Is that a problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Viktor ponders the question, Faith begins to do Simone deathbed speech from "Sunrise, Sunset".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Why are we here?  Is that what you're asking, Jack?... Why are we here?  No why.  Just here".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (this is too much for Viktor) Please put your clothes on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor gets up from the sofa, leaving the frustrated Fait straighten her clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The finished scene with SIMONE and HAL plays ON A SCREEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR watches the rough cut of "ETERNITY FOREVER" with ELAINE and daughter, LAINEY.  As usual, they are mesmeriz by the breath-taking beautiful SIMONE.  The scene ends. light go up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stunning, Viktor.  The Hollywood Foreign Press is going to eat this up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. (turning to his daughter) What did you think, Lainey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One thing bothered me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, Hal is as stiff as always.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not that.  I was just wondering -- in the bedroom scene in reel two why did Simone have no reflection when she walked in front of that mirror?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor is shocked, busted.  He covers it with a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ashen-faced) I wondered if you'd spot that.  You've got a good eye, Lainey.  I'm proud of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine looks at Viktor for an explanation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got them to remove the reflection.  The mirror's metaphor  -- to show how her character's inwardly dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's genius, Viktor.  Was that Simone's idea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic, annoyed at the suggestion) Who else?  It's always Simone's idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not quite convinced) So that accounts for the lack of a shadow in reel six?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precisely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR escorts ELAINE and LAINEY to Elaine's car parked outside the theater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as she gets into the car) Good-night, Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kissing Lainey good-bye) Night, Lainey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine and Viktor linger a moment outside the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (drawing Elaine aside) Elaine, I don't know if it's a good idea for Lainey to come to the screenings -- mature content and all that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both look to Lainey.  From inside the car Lainey watches parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impressed by his responsible attitude) Maybe you're right. (gently teasing) Twelve years after your daughter's born you decide to become a father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better late than never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softening) I should fire you more often.  The film's looking wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really think so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  To be honest I never quite saw this film before -- maybe it's the way Simone is playing it -- but what it's saying about the illusion of permanence in everyday life, how that's the only way we can love -- I think it's really going to mean something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  I'll tell Simone you liked it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love to tell her myself. (cajoling) When are you going to let me meet her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon.  Soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone I know has met her, Viktor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone you know is lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused) That's true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They instinctively kiss, more affectionate than before.  However, their embrace is interrupted by a click of a cam shutter from a nearby bush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damnit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PHOTOGRAPHER has gone but so has the mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how you can stop that.  She has to get out more. (climbing into the car) See you at the premiere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine climbs into her car and drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The premiere for "ETERNITY FOREVER" is everything VIKTOR hoped for "SUNRISE, SUNSET".  Red carpet, klieg lights searching the sky, screaming FANS and PAPARAZZI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A limousine pulls up, door opens and VIKTOR steps out.  T crowd screams with excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor waves.  Am expectancy in the crowd -- people crane their necks, waiting for someone else to step out of the car door... but nothing.  The door shuts.  A disappointed murmer.  The limo drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR walks down the carpet to little fanfare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (talking to camera) -- What a night!  Anyone who's anyone is here at the premiere of "Eternity Forever," but waiting for Simone to show may take even longer.  We do have her director, Viktor Taransky. (ushering him over) Viktor, Viktor, is Simone coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slightly irritated by the focus on the star) You know Simone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other reporters force their way into the interview.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope she does show up.  Some of her fans got here at dawn.  We don't want to disappoint them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through a pained smile) Well, I'm sure they're going to love the movie.  I got the inspiration --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: However, the reporter's attention has strayed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY EPSON!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERAS pivot away from Viktor.  Screen idol, HARRY EPSON, is walking up the carpet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry!  Harry!  Can we have a minute?  What brings you here tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving to the fans) I just came out to support my good friend, Simone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a rumor that you're more than just "good friends"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slightly irritated by the invasion) We've been seeing each other, sure, but we'd rather keep our relationship private.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (believing she has a scoop) Do I hear the sound of... wedding bells?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly losing it) I can't believe you people!  No wonder she never comes to these things!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry angrily pushes the camera away and strides up the carpet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR watches him go, flabbergasted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A packed, glitzy party.  VIKTOR enters without an escort. Despite his recent rise to prominence he appears strangel alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He observes ELAINE, champagne in hand, and the younger KE schmoozing with a group of industry MOVERS and SHAKERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine!  The picture is a revelation!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  I mean, it was a team effort --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor cannot resist taking Elaine's photo with a small pocket camera.  Elaine is unaware of the shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor turns away -- just as Elaine turns to look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor picks up a drink from the bar.  A DRUNK WOMAN, per unsteadily on a nearby barstool, is knocking back Jack Daniels.  She accidentally brushes one of her discarded glasses off the bar.  Viktor catches it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HAND taps Viktor on the shoulder.  HAL stands there accompanied by his "Eternity Forever" co-star, MAC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine, Hal.  How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (oblivious to his sarcasm) Somebody said she was here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mac spots the two glasses in Viktor's hands -- one glass lipstick-smeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, that's her glass! (impulsively smelling "Simone's" glass) Jack Daniels, straight-up.  She is my kind of woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking anxiously around the room) Viktor, where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dawning on him, glancing to the far side of the packed room) Jesus, Hal... she's in the Ladies Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I sometimes forget she has bodily functions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unable to resist) I know what you mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anxiously looking to the restroom) I have to talk to her about my experimental film.  It's very... experimental.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that her? -- By the fountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Far across the party, a WOMAN, with a Simone-type hairsty her back to us, is standing at the edge of a fountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (testy) No.  In fact, between us, she doesn't really exist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring him, calling out to the woman) Simone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIMONE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several nearby GUESTS, including ELAINE, overhear.  They over each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Simone's here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slightly the worse for drink) -- When did she arrive?  Why didn't someone tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- She's by the fountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Simone, over here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Simone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rumor races through the party like wild-fire.  The GU surge towards the fountain in a wave of mindless adoratio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Simone lookalike herself spins around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets knocked into the fountain.  Several other GUESTS also fall in the stampede.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back at the bar, the BARMAN, autograph book in hand, dese his station.  Viktor is left alone with the drunk woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The limousines outside the hotel ballroom have been repla with ambulances.  PARAMEDICS tend to GUESTS, bloodied and battered in the stampede caused by Simone's "appearance".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into microphone) -- Forget "Eternity Forever", the big news tonight was the surprise appearance of Simone.  Even these seen-it-all superstars are apparently not immune to Simone fever and the resulting stampede forced organizers to bring the event to an early end.  I spoke with some of the departing guests about their encounter with Hollywood's most reluctant superstar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUTS of interviews with VARIOUS bruised GUESTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I would say, even more beautiful in person, you have to see her to believe her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I can't reveal what we spoke about.  It was... personal.  Simone and I go back a long way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- When she talks to you, for that moment, you are the only other human being in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dress torn) -- I really don't know what the fuss is about.  So over-rated.  She's done one film.  Talk to me when she's had the kind of career I've had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I do expect her to be nominated, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We return to the live shot of the ENTERTAINMENT REPORTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fortunately, Simone was not amongst the injured and was spirited away as mysteriously as she arrived.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max Sayer's car is parked outside of the Echo Building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the ECHO war room, MAX SAYER is agitated.  He paces ba and forth, railing at a table of cowering STAFFERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- She goes to a major, Hollywood, A-list party and we don't get an interview, a comment, we don't even get a photograph?  Is that what you're telling me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody got a photograph.  Nobody ever gets a photograph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got our best people on it, Mr. Sayer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 24-hour tail on Taransky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shutter bugs camped outside any place he goes, every concierge and maitre d' on the take.  But this Simone woman is good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (referring to a "Confidential" FBI report) Obviously the name isn't real -- she's using an assumed identity, travels under a false name, checks into hotels with an alias.  She never stays in the same place two nights in a row.  Anything on the satellite photos? (irritated) What about the fingerprints?  What happened when we dusted that hotel suite?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILTON holds up a glass taken from the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we got some of Taransky's fingerprints, a lot of your fingerprints... but none of hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interest piqued) Which means they're significant. (beat) Incriminating. (beat) Perhaps, criminal. (getting excited) She's hiding her past.  She's hiding her past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max ponders the revelation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course -- no one's that perfect, that pure.  You know I had something on Mother Teresa.  But then she died and it wasn't worth it anymore. (approaching a computer) I know how to flush out this Simone -- a tell-all story from her childhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impressed) My God, you've got one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (offering Milton a seat in front of the computer) I will when you're finished writing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILTON hesitates, questioning his journalistic ethics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disappointed in his protege) Am I wasting my time with you?  When she sues to protect her privacy, she'll have to appear in a public courtroom to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Long live the First Amendment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes you have to tell a small lie to get to the bigger truth. (to his nervous photographer) As for a photo -- if you can't do it, I know twelve million people who can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE UP on The Echo magazine -- "CIRCULATION - 12 MILLIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "MILLION DOLLAR REWARD FOR PHOTO OF SIMONE!" -- Is the headline on the cover of The ECHO.  VIKTOR is reading the magazine as he makes his way through the studio lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up to see several studio carts parked outside hi soundstage.  A group of STUDIO EXECUTIVES, led by ELAINE, trying to break into the "CLOSED SET".  VIKTOR runs towar the door, throwing himself between the door and the executives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You can't go in there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- We have to talk to her, Viktor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- We know she's in there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor glares at the SECURITY GUARD who shrugs weakly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggling to hold them back) -- Why?  What's all this about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving a spreadsheet) -- We've got the tracking numbers for "Eternity Forever".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- They're in the toilet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- She has to get out there and sell the film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- What do you want her to do, go door-to-door -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Even Garbo would be on the talk show circuit if she was alive today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritated) -- It's precisely because she doesn't crave the limelight that people love her.  I told you, she's only about the work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- This is over-shadowing the work!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving the front page of The Echo) That's the problem.  She's more famous for her no-shows than her shows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- It's starting to look like she doesn't support the film or you, Viktor. (trying to squeeze past Viktor) If you can't handle her, I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blocking her path) Not now.  She's emotional.  Her mother dies today.  Scene forty-two of "Good For Nothing".  It's not a good time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine and the executives are not convinced, they overpow Viktor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  Please, don't go in there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late.  Elaine and the suits force the lock and enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE and the EXECUTIVES stop in their tracks -- confron with the surreal sight of the lone computer station in th vast soundstage.  A desperate VIKTOR catches up with them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine... I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine wanders over to the idle computer with a knowing smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, the secret's finally out, Viktor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I can explain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I don't think that's necessary.  I think it's perfectly clear.  I should have guessed -- it all makes sense now... it's why she never goes anywhere, never seen in public...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor lowers his head, resigned to his fate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's into computers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding in agreement) Probably spends her whole life in chat rooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the one place she can be herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anonymous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor seizes on the opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (adopting a serious tone) It's worse than you think.  She's extremely agoraphobic -- has a morbid fear of people and germs.  In a way I'm relieved you... found out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Executives are taken aback by the shocking revelation

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The premiere was the first time I've convinced her to venture out and it just confirmed her worst nightmares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned) Viktor, you should have said something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't want pity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seeing a new side of Viktor) You're so good to protect her like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor shrugs modestly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Executives, conceding) I'll tell you what.  I know how much this means to you.  I'll try to get her to plug the film. (beat) I'm not promising anything but maybe she'll do a talk show -- taped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, make it live -- please, Viktor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try.  Maybe live but remote.  She'll never go to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We understand.  Thank you, Viktor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give her our best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satisfied, the Executives make their way out of the soundstage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aside to a colleague) That agoraphobia -- it's like a plague.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's out of control in Europe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor and Elaine are left alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I didn't get a chance to introduce you to Simone at the premiere.  There wasn't time with the riot and everything. (picking up a framed photo from the work station) But she wanted you to have this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The photograph shows ELAINE, slightly inebriated at the premiere, SIMONE standing slightly behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was there.  She didn't by any chance happen to mention me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said you were very beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flattered) Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blurting out) Elaine, what are you doing tonight?  Would you like to go somewhere -- dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love to.  But aren't you supposed to meet up with Simone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes.  Of course.  Don't I always?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor watches Elaine make her way back to her studio car

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor realizes he is still holding a copy of the Nationa ECHO -- the headline, "MILLION DOLLAR REWARD FOR PHOTO OF SIMONE"!  Accompanied by a photo of intrepid reporter MAX SAYER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An unattended shopping cart, at the end of the frozen foo aisle, begins to mysteriously roll towards us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We discover VIKTOR, pulling the cart with fishing line, w at the same time shooting it with a video camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor's home video of the shopping cart plays on a TV.  However, now SIMONE is pushing the cart.  She wears sunglasses, her hair in curlers under a scarf.  Simone ta a Swanson Chicken Pot Pie out of a cabinet... then a box cereal off a display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAX SAYER watches the video in his office, enraptured.  H rewinds the tape and replays the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She likes Apple Jacks... just like me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assistant MILTON enters.  He looks ill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Sayer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritated at being interrupted) What do you want -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Sayer, did we pay the million bucks yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (never averting his eyes from the screen) -- Cashier's check went out to our anonymous tipster this morning -- worth every penny too.  Who says there's no place for checkbook journalism?  We'll be running stills of this for months, then release the whole tape -- we'll get our money back -- maybe show it on an exclusive pay-per-view event.  Do you realize what we have here?  We have the only independent footage of Simone in existence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We used to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max's head snaps around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding a copy of the L.A. Times Calendar section - "Simone Live") She's doing Frank Brand on Thursday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max coughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The opening credits to "FRANK BRAND LIVE", a global cable show plays against a starscape -- images of famous politicians and world leaders interviewed by Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to camera) Tonight on Frank Brand Live --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE, KENT and LAINEY watch the TV interview in Elaine' mansion with eager anticipation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Since taking the nation by storm with her debut movie, "Sunrise, Sunset"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAX SAYER and assistant MILTON are also glued to their se

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... no one's managed to land a live TV interview with the fabulous, new shooting starlet, Simone... until now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Casually tacked up on the monitor is the MILLION DOLLAR C from The ECHO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR, face and body scanned by the computer, is making final test of his equipment.  When he touches his hair, b his eyes, moves his hands -- so does Simone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR frantically tests several different backgrounds be SIMONE from a library of images.  Rainforest.  Desert.  R hotel suite.  Moonscape.  Factory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make up your mind, Viktor.  Make up your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He settles on the desert location.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He also make a last-second change to Simone's wardrobe -- selecting "TOO-TIGHT SWEATER".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK BRAND talks to camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm happy to say she's agreed to join us tonight from the set of her new film. (turning to the TV monitor) Welcome, Simone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The just-completed image of SIMONE appears on Brand's monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonderful to be with you, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KENT, referring to Simone, forgetting or not caring that Elaine is in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is all woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAINEY shoots her mother's boyfriend a withering look.  S gets up and leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During the interview we cut between Frank Brand's studio, Viktor's soundstage and various viewer locations includin Elaine's mansion, Max Sayer's office and various worldwid locations --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A)  A lone AFGHANI SHEPHERD gazing at a Watchman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B)  A JAPANESE COUPLE watching TV in a capsule hotel room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C)  A CATHOLIC CARDINAL watching TV in the Vatican.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, no one could accuse you of being over-exposed, Simone.  Why have you stayed so completely out of the limelight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) I just think actors talk too much.  Does the world really want to hear your life story just because you've got a movie opening Friday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, the only problem with shying away from publicity these days is that it tends to attract more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR is in his element, his effeminate gestures frighteningly convincing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from TV) Don't I know it.  That's the only reason I'm here now -- to put the attention back where it belongs, on Mr. Taransky's film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't secretly want the attention?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not even sure I deserve it.  After tonight I'll have almost as much screen time on your show as I do in my movies.  How is that healthy for a performer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAINEY has turned her back on the TV screen, preferring t look through a book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from TV) Because, you have to understand, Frank, these interviews -- none of this is real.  Who I am on screen and who I really am are two totally different people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a good question. (beat) As Nietzsche said, "Whenever a man strives long and hard to appear someone else..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading from a bookmarked page, along with Simone) "... he ends up finding it is difficult to be himself again."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well put.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lainey regards the name written on the inside page -- "Vi Taransky".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TV playing in the background, MAX and MILTON are hurriedl leafing through travel books and scrutinizing maps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (focusing on the desert background behind Simone) I know where that is... I know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Change of topic.  Simone, you've been romantically linked to dozens of men in the press -- Mick Jagger, Stephen Hawking, Fidel Castro... and most recently Viktor Taransky.  Is there a Mr. Right in there somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd rather not discuss my private life. (gently) But Viktor and I are inseparable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE's face drops, slightly hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dog, Viktor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from TV) I literally wouldn't be here today without him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR accidentally taps his finger on the keyboard in hi excitement -- the cursor aimed at "TEARS" command.  SIMON EYES start to well with tears -- a tear spills from her e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like a moment, Simone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor notices, quickly withdrawing his finger -- his startled expression instantly imitated by Simone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's talk about the work that you care so much about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  Where would you like to start?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about the nudity?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nudity has just never been an issue for me, Frank.  For me, clothes are just an option.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What exactly was it that attracted you to your first two projects?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unable to resist a smile) I suppose the thing I like most about the movies I'm in is that they're not about special effects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank nods sagely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're better for it if I may say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The smile is suddenly wiped off VIKTOR's face by a blinki alert:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pixels that form SIMONE start to break up.  Curiously is only Simone and not the background that is disintegrat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (regarding the screen) Well, we appear to be experiencing satellite difficulties.  In case we lose you, Simone, I want to thank you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR speaks again, his voice suddenly deeper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank... YOU, FRANK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In horror Viktor hurriedly pulls the plug.  The feed goes blank on Frank Brand's screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR slumps over his computer in exhaustion.  Since SIM is still synced to his movements, the partially de-pixela Simone also slumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor's cell phone rings.  Viktor picks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hel--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He remembers at the last second to switch off his voice synthesizer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We cut between the two sides of the conversation -- ELAIN the phone, KENT still watching post-interview analysis on TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Viktor, are you with her?  Is she there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An anxious beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you and Simone... (blurting it out) ... getting married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taken aback by the suggestion) No, of course not! (realizing the significance of the question) Why?  Would you care if we were?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (covering, realizing she has given herself away) Well, yes.  From a studio point of view, it would be better if Simone stayed single. (quick change of topic) Anyhow, I thought she came across great tonight.  Intelligent, well informed, a natural.  And touching.  She was spectacular.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor, do you realize you always do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whenever I compliment Simone, you take the credit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you do... (shrug) Anyway, tonight was a good start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?  Start?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a crowded summer.  We need every photo-opp, sound-byte and column inch we can get.  Good night, Viktor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine hangs up.  Lainey approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (carefully broaching the subject) Mom, do you miss Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she thinks) Sometimes.  But, just when I think your father's changing for the better, I realize he's as self absorbed as ever.  He took the credit for Simone tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lainey, coming to her father's defense, glancing at the Nietzsche book in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think Dad deserves more credit than he gets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR watches SIMONE on screen.  He is unusually anxious

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As usual SIMONE is wearing a skimpy, provocative outfit a she awaits instructions on the screen.  For some reason Viktor becomes irritated by the image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Simone) Will you cover yourself up!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits a button.  A thick WOOL COAT clicks over her body

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ECHO newscar streaks through the bronze and purple desert.  MAX and his assistant MILTON emerge from the car

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I've been here before! -- On my honeymoon with my ex-wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that why she left you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max holds a video print of SIMONE giving her FRANK BRAND interview.  He compares her desert location to the one in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing out a Joshua tree) You see, that's the exact same tree and in the distance, there's the... (voice trailing away) ... mountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure enough, the Joshua tree is identical but the mountai now obscured by a ten-story Holiday Inn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and Milton are mystified -- they look back at the pho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could they have built that hotel since yesterday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max shakes his head, deeply concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR has transformed his soundstage into a one-man publicity machine.  The floor is littered with photograph SIMONE in various states of dress and undress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using a sophisticated Photoshop computer program, VIKTOR constructs magazine spreads out of numerous previous maga spreads -- "Time", "People", "Us", "Life", "Popular Mechanics".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angrily into phone) -- We don't do the photo shoot, you don't get the cover... written answers to written questions, that's right... website interviews, no problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor calls up a "DANCE OPTION".  Choosing from a HULA DANCER, a BELLY DANCER and a CLASSICAL BALLERINA, he remo Simone's head and places it on the body of the ballerina. She begins to dance for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He uses a program to construct childhood photographs of SIMONE and other childhood memorabilia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He employs backgrounds from numerous on-line library sour With a quick cut and paste he is able to place Simone on beach in San Tropez or a bicycle factory in Calcutta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muttering to himself) You want exposure, Elaine?  I'll give you over-exposure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE watches TV in her office.  She cannot change chann without finding Simone sitting in a chair giving generic answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think "Eternity Forever" is my finest work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm most proud of my work in "Eternity Forever".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think people are going to love "Eternity Forever".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR inspects a cut-out photograph of Simone in "ETERNI FOREVER" costume.  He speaks to the photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive me, Simone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The photograph of Simone is emblazoned on a fast food dri cup -- a pyramid of cups promoting "ETERNITY FOREVER" Hap Meals.  Beneath the plastic pyramid is a SIMONE action fi in a convertible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screams the banner headline in "Variety".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: $$$IMONE - WINS 6TH WEEKEND IN A ROW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouts the "Hollywood Reporter".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trade papers sit on the coffee table in front of VIKT who reclines on a leather sofa, watching TV, gazing lovin at Simone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, being a movie star is wonderful, but I have so many other ways I want to express myself --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Various book titles are on display:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "SIMONE'S FAVORITE SOUTHERN RECIPES"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "HUMAN:KIND - The POETRY of SIMONE"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A banner in a window reads.  "In Stock: SIMONE'S EASY-WEA FASHION".  Mannequins model the clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We focus on the screen where VIKTOR types in instructions

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A list of the Number 1 hits for the last forty years prom appears on the screen along with photographs of the artists --

dialogues.speaker: PATSY CLINE, ELLA FITZGERALD, ARETHA FRANKLIN, JANICE JOP
dialogues.text: CAROL KING, WHITNEY HOUSTON, MADONNA, etc.  Beneath the t of each song is a graphic representation of the music -- "PITCH" and "RESONANCE".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor presses a button: "MORPH".  The audio waves conver

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR, wearing headphones, records his composite pop son As usual when he sings into his microphone, Simone also sings.  The catchy song is titled: "(If You Can't Believe Yourself) Believe In Me".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The video for SIMONE's song plays on the video wall insid the record store.  TEENAGE GIRLS, buying CD's, dance adoringly in front of the screen, unaware that they are gyrating to the vocals of a middle-aged man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSERT - "(If You Can't Believe In Yourself) Believe In M shoots up the Billboard charts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE UP on the name "SIMONE" painted on the stern of a luxury yacht.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR is at the helm, breathing in the clean air -- at l a moment to savor his success.  Simone's hit single plays the yacht's stereo.  He looks at peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TOURIST has his arm around SIMONE, having his photograp taken.  However, we discover that the Simone is only a lifesize cardboard cutout used by a STREET VENDOR to sell snapshots.  He also has cardboard cutouts of the POPE and ELVIS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAX SAYER and MILTON walk by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tying up his boat, VIKTOR's mood is abruptly shattered by sight of Max and Milton walking down the pier towards him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice boat, Taransky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a yacht.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you're up to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pushing past Max) I don't have time for this, Sayer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you do. (holding up his video print of Simone in the desert) I know it's a fake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got your attention now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max compares the shot to one of the current desert locati with the Holiday Inn in front of the mountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (referring to the photographs) It's bogus.  You used an old library shot for the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ashen) The background is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was never in New Mexico.  She never left the studio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor is relieved that Max is only accusing him of fakin the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (referring to a large bundle of other shots under his arm) I've done my homework.  I've studied her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I bet you have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I've looked at every piece of publicity she's ever done, the video in the supermarket, there's no evidence she's ever left the studio. (afterthought) Oh, and for some reason this woman leaves no paper trail.  But I have "obtained" a copy of your bank accounts.  I know you have power of attorney but so far you haven't transferred one single solitary cent to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm keeping it in trust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that's what you'd like us to believe.  But I got to tell you -- embezzlement is a serious matter.  Not to mention abduction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abduction?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't buy the whole recluse scam.  How are you doing it?  What is it -- drugs?  Blackmail?  Mind-control?  All three?  What do you do -- keep her locked in a box somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor flinches at the remark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it exactly you want, Sayer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see her.  Unless you show me Simone live and in person I show these pictures to the authorities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor pauses, considering the threat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, Sayer, you've got a deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Er,... good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor walks away leaving Max confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The breeze whips the photos of SIMONE out of Max's hands into the sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vast, empty stadium.  On the stage, a lone microphone.  VIKTOR approaches, gazing out at the vast arena.  Several PROMOTERS and TECHNICIANS join him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All ready, Mr. Taransky.  This time tomorrow night, she'll be standing right here in front of a packed house.  We could have sold it out twenty times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soundcheck went perfect.  Laser show ready to go. (cautionary note) I gotta say, you ordered an awful lot of smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the way she likes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Promoter glancing to the area in front of the stage, where a barrier has been erected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After what you told us about the death threats, the security guards are under strict instructions never to take their eyes off the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor hands each man a headshot of SIMONE signed with a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simone wanted you to have these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (visibly moved by the gesture) Wish her luck from us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I will. (afterthought) Remember, no cameras, no binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the shadow of the enormous stadium sits a control truck/tour bus, satellite dishes on the roof -- the light from the laser-show inside the arena play off the truck. control truck shakes from the stomping of the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... SI-MONE!  SI-MONE!  SI-MONE!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to the truck is marked, "SIMONE - Splendid Isola Tour.  NO ENTRY".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR sits alone at the mixing panel of a control truck. his monitors, a sea of humanity, chanting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... SI-MONE!  SI-MONE!  SI-MONE!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor produces the "SIMULATION ONE" hard-drive from his jacket pocket and inserts it into the computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIMONE appears on the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get you into hair and make up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simone's hair rapidly grows in a number of styles, eyelas grow and are trimmed, eyeshadow of various shades paints across the lids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wardrobe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor tries several outfits on Simone -- the clothes appearing to fabricate themselves on her body.  He settle for the most provocative outfit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finger poised over the keyboard, Viktor glances to a moni showing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE and LAINEY amongst the crowd, clapping their hands stomping their feet and chanting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easier to make one hundred thousand believe than just one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He scrolls to a program, marked "HOLOGRAM" and pushes the "ENTER" key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoke fills the stage.  A strobe light show plays.  A boo ANNOUNCER is heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, Viktor Taransky Promotions is proud to present, live on stage, for the debut concert of the "Splendid Isolation" tour, the one, the only, SI-MONE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spotlight falls on the solitary figure of Simone, stand alone on the stage with a guitar over her shoulder (the o accompaniment) -- dwarfed by the huge stage.  However, on closer inspection, the spotlight is actually a laser beam creating a hologram.  Clouds of smoke and strobe lighting the illusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only clear view of Simone for the audience is provide the enormous video screens on either side of the stage. CROWD stares up at the jumbotrons, blissfully unaware tha they are watching a pre-recorded event.  Some watch the e on portable TVs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE UP on the computer screen.  VIKTOR scrolls down a l of options -- "... HOUSTON, MIAMI, NEW YORK, L.A...."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from on stage) I love you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He selects "L.A.".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd roars its approval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's great to be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIMONE -- her voice a seamless blend of several DIVAS -- begins to sing her hit song, "(If You Can't Believe In Yourself) Believe In Me".  A verse of the song is sung in perfect Spanish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A)  On a jumbotron in Tokyo SIMONE's concert plays LIVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B)  On a TV set on a West African beach, children dance t SIMONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C)  On a computer in a Bombay taxi, the driver and his passengers gyrate to SIMONE webcast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR's face is reflected in a monitor showing a frenzie crowd gazing up at the jumbotron -- singing along, many i tears, overcome with emotion -- holding cigarette lighter aloft.  For a moment Viktor is in awe of his own wizardry the grand illusionist.  Viktor is at the height of his powers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the image of Simone on his screen) I don't know about you, Simone, but I've never felt more alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He snaps back to reality just in time to notice that the Simone hologram beam has wandered through her own microph stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He adjusts the beam -- the rapturous crowd, transfixed by TV screen, apparently fails to notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We focus on a face in the crowd -- MAX SAYER.  His journalistic assignment temporarily forgotten, Max is sin along and waving his arms, tears rolling down his face, s up in the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIMONE finishes her final number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-night.  Never stop believing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bin contains dozens of confiscated cameras and binocula FANS exit the stadium through a tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S-I-M-O-N-E is spelt out on the bare chests of six TEENAG BOYS.  Other FANS wear "SIMONE - Splendid Isolation Tour" T-shirts and carry posters.  Several CONCERT GOERS speak TV NEWS CREW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I swear, she looked right at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- She was, like, ethereal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- One moment she seemed to walk right through her mike stand like it wasn't even there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chanting crowd can be heard exiting.  VIKTOR, wearing lipstick is hastily signing a pile of souvenir programs w Simone's signature kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is interrupted by a knock at the door.  Viktor irritab opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I didn't want to be interrupt --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE and LAINEY stand at the foot of the trailer, a SECURITY GUARD nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (face brightening) My two favorite girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lainey and I just wanted to congratulate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Regarding Viktor closely, Elaine's smile evaporates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Simone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's lying down.  She's exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly cool) I can imagine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor is confused by their reaction.  Elaine yanks Laine away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank Simone for the tickets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling back as she is led away) It was a great show, Dad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor waves disconcertedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you... going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he returns to the trailer, Viktor catches sight of his lipstick-smeared mouth in the mirror on the inside of the trailer door.  He slams the side of the trailer in frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE paces back and forth in front of her TV showing re runs of the SIMONE concert.  KENT cannot take his eyes of the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe she's doing this -- taking advantage of him this way.  It's cruel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously, this can't last.  She's going to dump him.  Viktor won't be able to take that.  He's too sensitive.  It'll destroy him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine, do you realize you can't stop talking about Viktor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not hearing) I have to talk to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kent switches off the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been meaning to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the open door, we find LAINEY eavesdropping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR, deep in thought, stands at the water's edge, star at the breaking waves.  LAINEY joins him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Lainey. (gently teasing her) How's your love life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do okay.  How about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know me -- married to my work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I noticed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, you know I don't like to get between you and mom but she's feeling down right now.  She broke up with Kent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (buoyed by the news) Really?  Too bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She thinks you're with Simone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lainey, you know Simone and I don't have a real relationship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know but Mom doesn't.  Maybe if it came from Simone, if Simone spoke to Mom -- she could straighten things out. (shrug) Dinner, maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner?  Dinner's difficult.  A phone call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too impersonal.  They have to meet face-to-face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see what I can do. (a thought occurs) You know, Lainey.  I don't believe you've ever once asked to meet Simone.  Don't you like her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love her but that doesn't mean I need to meet her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor is confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?  So I can tell my friends at school -- as if that validates my life somehow.  What's Simone going to say to a fourteen-year-old anyhow?  She's going to be polite because you're my father but we're not suddenly going to become friends -- we have nothing in common.  It's not going to be real.  Anyhow, she gets more beautiful in my head every day.  Why kill the dream?  What do they say, "don't get too close to your idols, they always disappoint you".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor gazes in wonder at his daughter, so much wiser tha her years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Lainey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too, daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car horn sounds outside the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Mom. (kissing him on the forehead) See you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She exits, leaving Viktor deep in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milli Vanilli's "GIRL YOU KNOW IT'S TRUE" plays on a car radio.  ELAINE, wearing a red power suit, drives home alo the freeway in bumper-to-bumper traffic.  Her car phone rings.  She turns down the radio and picks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, is this Elaine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes -- oh my, God.  Is that you, Simone?!  I've been wanting to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, here I am. (beat) You look pretty today.  Red suits you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around the freeway) Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right beside you.  I borrowed Viktor's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine looks to the inside lane.  SIMONE, wearing sunglas phone to her ear, drives alongside.  Simone waves, somewh mechanically.  Elaine waves back.  They keep driving as t talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sunglasses-clad SIMONE is a mannequin, seated in the driver's seat with her left hand on the phone obscuring h mouth, right hand attached to the steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seat fully-reclined on the passenger side, VIKTOR drives car by stretching a foot across to the pedals and steerin with one hand, occasionally sneaking a glance to the road ahead.  He speaks on a phone through the Simone synthesiz

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love to stop somewhere but I'm late.  I'm on my way to see Viktor now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I understand.  That's what I want to talk about.  I don't know if you know this, Simone, but Viktor and I were married once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't imagine how you ever let a man like that go.  I owe Viktor everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he owes more to you.  But that's not important now.  I know what's going on between you two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to reassure you, Elaine, there's absolutely nothing going on between Viktor and I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rueful smile) You don't have to protect my feelings, Simone.  I don't blame Viktor for falling in love with the most desirable woman in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breaking character) I'm not -- (correcting himself) He's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor, losing concentration on his driving, drifts acros his lane, almost striking Elaine's car -- swerving back a the last second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, are you alright, Simone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn -- (struggling to stay in her/his lane) Yes -- I -- (regaining control) -- I'm just a little tired.  Listen, Elaine, Viktor and I -- it's strictly a working relationship.  We could never be anything else.  We're just so... different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.  You're a household name now.  You're moving in entirely different worlds.  That's why I hope you're not toying with Viktor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounds like you still have feelings for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a daughter together.  I just don't want to see Viktor get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how many times I have to say this, Elaine, but Viktor and I are not in love. (joking weakly) I only make love to the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simone, I recognize the shirt you're wearing.  I gave it to Viktor on his birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over-correcting his steering, Viktor drifts into the next lane, dangerously close to a pick-up truck that has to sw to avoid him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ -- (still struggling to stay on the road) Elaine, I know how it looks but... (blurting it out) ... it would mean a lot to Viktor if you'd go with him to the Oscars.  If you won't do it for him, please do it for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reluctant, frightened by Simone's erratic driving) Okay -- for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sigh of relief) Thanks.  This is my exit so, I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad we talked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor's car swerves to the right.  Elaine looks back in rearview mirror, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine just misses the sight of VIKTOR's car rear-ending truck in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR anxiously watches a HIGHWAY PATROLMAN writing up t fender-bender.  However, the Patrolman is more interested the Simone mannequin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to explain.  I know what the press is like.  Lunatics.  Out of control. (referring to the Simone mannequin) You do know I'm going to have to take this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR, in his tuxedo, sits in the front row of the packe auditorium beside an empty seat -- "RESERVED for SIMONE". ELAINE and LAINEY sit alongside -- LOTUS and MAC nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL stands at the transparent plastic podium with the "Be Actress" envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the winner is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal tears the envelope's seal, momentarily confused as he reads the name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, there's a tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The AUDIENCE gasps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (milking the moment for all it's worth) The winners are... Simone for "Sunrise, Sunset"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The audience cheers enthusiastically, but Hal stills thei applause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (big smile) ... and Simone for "Eternity Forever".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The audience erupts.  Viktor accepts the congratulations those around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unfortunately, Simone can't be with us tonight. (turning to the screen) But thanks to the miracle of modern technology she is able to join us live via satellite from the location of her new film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screen flickers to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIMONE sits in a director's chair in the desolate wastela location chosen by Viktor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you!  Thank you!  This means so much to me.  I'm just sorry I can't be there with you.
