(wiping away a tear) First off I have to acknowledge my fellow nominees -- I don't even feel I belong in the best actress category let alone with these... wonderful human beings. (composing herself) I also have to thank my co-stars, the studio, of course.  But most of all, I have to thank the audience for supporting what I do -- you're the only reason I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CROWD applauds wildly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAINEY is puzzled.  She leans over to Viktor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't she thank you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) She did... didn't she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crestfallen) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor glances to the "Simone" sign beside him.  The bloo drains from his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the monitor, SIMONE reads the forgotten line from the speech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And of course I must thank my collaborator, Viktor Taransky, without whom none of this would be possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR, still in his tuxedo, stares at SIMONE on the scre He holds the text of Simone's acceptance speech in his ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) It's written right there... Why didn't I say it?... How could I forget to say it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simone stares back at him blankly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A copy of VARIETY is slid under the soundstage door.  The front page headline, "NO THANK YOU - Simone Snubs Taransk Oscars".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR pulls up to the gate of his Malibu home.  MAX is standing outside next to his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR also spies an OLD WOMAN in a wheelchair sitting be the car, MILTON closeby.  Viktor stops at the gate and reluctantly exits his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What now, Sayer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smug smile, noticing Viktor noticing the woman) Looks familiar, doesn't she?  No one comes from nowhere, Taransky.  You turn over enough rocks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old woman appears drugged, stares into space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I traced her to a nursing home.  A young woman fitting Simone's description dropped her off five years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks a lot like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (undeterred) She hasn't uttered a word that whole time -- until she saw the big show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max produces a shot of SIMONE at the Oscars and holds it front of the old lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to Simone's picture, catatonic) My baby... My baby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (putting his hand on his heart) Who would think that "Saint Simone" would abandon her own mother?  I've been looking into the family history -- heartbreaking.  Most likely a biography to run over four issues... who knows, maybe there's a Pulitzer in there somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor produces his own driver's license and holds it in front of the old lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to Viktor's face on the driver's license) My baby... My baby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max hastily steps between Viktor and the Old Lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't prove a thing -- wait until I get a court order for a blood test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sensing an opportunity) That won't be necessary. (pretending to be resigned) Sooner or later I knew you'd crack this thing, Max.  You got me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do? (recovering) Sure I do. (taking Viktor aside) Can we speak off the record?  I'm a fair man.  I'm willing to sit down with her and tell her side of the story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't want you to compromise your ethics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Thanks.  Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor regards the newshound with a look of pity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You love her, don't you, Max?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (writes a check, hands it to Max) This should take care of Mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor drives into his home.  Max, very confused, stares the old lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR escorts LAINEY, blindfolded, around the corner of soundstage.  He removes the blindfold.  From Lainey's poi of-view we see the sportscar Simone drove in "ETERNITY FOREVER" -- the car tied with a bow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy birthday, Lainey.  Do you like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking in the car) It's fantastic -- it's too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the car she drove in "Eternity Forever".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  Thank her for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disappointed by her reaction) It's from both of us.  Of course you'll have to drive it around the lot until you get your permit --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lainey averts her gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I can't accept it.  I don't want a car, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clearly hurt, not understanding) Why not?  I can get you something else.  What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old Viktor Taransky. (finally blurting it out) I liked you better before -- before all this.  You were a loser, Dad, but at least you had integrity.  I can't stand to see you like this -- clinging to Simone's coattails -- it used to be about the work, and now it's all about her.  And then she's not even grateful enough to thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that was me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you go again, blaming yourself.  Can't you see what she's done to you -- she's taking advantage, mocking you.  You deserve better than Simone. (hasty exit) I've got to go, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lainey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor watches Lainey depart towards the studio gates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT.  SIMONE & VIKTOR'S OFFICE - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR leans on his desk, still reflecting on LAINEY's remarks.  JANE enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready for your casting session?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor nods distractedly.  Jane shows in NICOLA ANDERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicola's here for the role of Simone's sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor offers Nicola a seat, staring at her as if he has never truly looked at her before -- she has a quality of Simone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slightly uncomfortable by Viktor's scrutiny) A lot's happened since we last saw each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (numb) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never apologized properly for what happened on "Sunrise".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands Viktor a peace offering -- a large jar of Mike Ike candy, including cherry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  It's not important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After I saw what Simone did with the role -- you know I fired all my people, went into rehab, took acting classes, changed my whole look.  She really inspired me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor continues to stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (referring to the script in her hands) Would you like me to read?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'd like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicola glances at the script a last time and puts it down She approaches Viktor, standing close to him, playing the scene to him -- an immediate intimacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (her angry words are in opposition to her amorous actions) -- Who do you think you are, Carlos -- coming in here like this?  With my husband sleeping in the next room.  Do you think I won't call out?  Do you think I will just give in to you without a fight -- like the last time and the time before that? (she kisses his ear) I wish you were dead. (she kisses his lips) I wish we were both dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicola immediately breaks character.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor is mesmerized -- he has fallen back in love with flesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally able to speak) You know you're really very good.  I take back what I said.  I mean, you're really good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (forgetting himself) You could play the lead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) But that's Simone's part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, of course it is. (gazing at her face) You know you have a line here.  Not a wrinkle.  Actually, more of a dimple.  I've been thinking of incorporating something like that in Simone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) You'd cosmetically alter Simone to look like me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, of course not, you're right.  That would be crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor sits back down and stares out of the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want me to do it again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor does not reply.  Nicola quietly leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front page of "Variety" is dominated by a large photograph of SIMONE giving her acceptance speech via satellite.  However, ELAINE is gazing at a small inset picture of VIKTOR, HERSELF and LAINEY arriving at the Osc Ceremony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine tears out the photo and slips it into her purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old home video of ELAINE.  She is in a garden by a swimmi pool, laughing, waving and sweetly flirting with the came Elaine raises her skirt teasingly, winks, gestures the ca operator towards her with a beckoning finger, finally blo kiss to the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While the ever-seductive SIMONE waits patiently on-screen Viktor's instructions, VIKTOR is gazing at the smaller monitor -- the home video of ELAINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor freezes the tape.  Elaine appears particularly beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor electronically cuts out Elaine's mannerism and mor it into Simone.  Now Simone blows the kiss and has the sa dazzling smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT.  SIMONE & VIKTOR'S OFFICE - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At her desk, JANE is busy trying to mimic Simone's hairst as she talks on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) -- Oh sure, she comes in all the time... we've become close.  She told me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR enters the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane hurriedly hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picking up a pile of scripts from the in-tray) I'm leaving early tonight.  If you need me I'll be at the beach house having dinner with a... certain someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane tries to conceal her interest.  As soon as Viktor ex the office, JANE picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone, under her breath) ... Elaine Christian please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We reveal VIKTOR, outside the door, eavesdropping on his assistant, pleased she has taken the bait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR dims the lights, plays "mood" music.  The doorbell rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He checks himself in the mirror.  In the reflection, he s an autographed photo of HIMSELF with his arm around SIMON He hurriedly hides the photo and answers the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE stands there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor, I'm picking up Lainey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine is over-dressed for her supposed errand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine, it's Wednesday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (feigning absent mindedness) Is it Wednesday?  It's Wednesday.  How embarrassing.  I don't know what I was thinking.  With all the excitement lately... (peering past him) Am I interrupting something?  Are you expecting company?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ushering her inside) As a matter-of-fact I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When is she coming over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glancing to his watch) About now.  Would you like a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose I could stay, just until she arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine takes a seat on the sofa.  Viktor hands her a glas wine and sits beside her -- close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both knock back their wine in one long gulp, both apparently in need of courage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to make conversation) Is Simone back to earth yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not quite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure you'll keep her focussed.  She's lucky to have you, Viktor. (blurting out) Is she really having your baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (instantly regretting the remark) I just read somewhere --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  I know.  They'll say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- And she was positively glowing at the awards. (making to leave) I should be going, she'll be here soon --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor puts his finger to her lips to hush her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- She already is.  Simone's not coming over, Elaine.  Not tonight, not ever. (holding her) I want you back, Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (melting) I want you back too, Viktor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss.  Elaine breaks the kiss, suddenly consumed wit doubt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is crazy.  Who am I fooling?  I can't compete with Simone.  What woman can?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would rather have you than Simone.  Believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's sweet, Viktor, but I couldn't let you do that -- make that kind of sacrifice. (meeting his gaze) It's strange.  I've stabbed people in the back, clawed and slept my way to where I am -- it goes with the territory -- but, for some reason, I can't betray Simone.  There's... I don't know any other way to say it -- there's a goodness to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, there isn't.  There's nothing to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Viktor.  You say that now -- because we're here, alone, like this.  But in the morning, you'd go back to her.  What man wouldn't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I will end my relationship with her -- totally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you don't understand.  She'll always be there -- at some party, on some magazine cover, some song on the radio, up on some screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperate) No.  She'll never work again -- retire, never make a movie or a record, or appear ever again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) Of course she will.  Her public will demand it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if I don't let her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor knocks back another glass of wine for courage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to tell you a secret now, Elaine. (mustering all his nerve) Simone is not a real person.  I invented her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (misinterpreting his remark) Every actor is an invention, Viktor.  Don't embarrass yourself.  No one's denying that you discovered Simone.  But it's like finding a diamond in the desert.  Anyone can trip over it, but it's not the finder who sparkles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (agitated) -- No, no, I didn't trip over her.  You don't understand --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring him) -- You just got lucky that she's loyal enough to stay with you.  Maybe she's staying out of pity, who knows?  She certainly doesn't need you.  Some people even say you're holding her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wounded) Who says that -- ? (shaking off the insult) -- Never mind.  You have to listen to me, Elaine.  Simone is thin air, pixels, molded by me from a mathematical equation.  I inherited it from a madman -- I can show you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much wine have you had?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- She's a figment of my own imagination.  I, Viktor Taransky, have perpetrated the greatest hoax, the greatest sleight-of-hand, sleight-of-mouth, sleight-of- sleight in entertainment history! And still no one appreciates me, recognizes what I've done -- even you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rolling her eyes) You're drunker than I thought.  Are you doing that again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  Whatever talent Simone has comes from me -- me!  Me!  I swear, as God is my judge.  You don't know what I've been through.  Tens of thousands of mind-numbing hours in front of that screen, nights without end, and look what it's cost me. (producing his spectacles) Why do you think I've been wearing these?  I may have done irreparable harm to my eyesight, and why?  To extract and refine the infinite nuances of a human being -- a human soul. (a final explanation) Don't you see?  I made Simone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause.  His words hang in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made Simone? (a trace of pity) Viktor, she made you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine gets up and walks out, leaving the distraught Vikt alone in his house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hung-over VIKTOR enters his office.  Suddenly, he stops confronts the standee of SIMONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bitch!  I'll destroy you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE stares in shock.  She discreetly exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR sits in front of his monitor, smiling venomously a SIMONE.  He begins to digitally disrobe Simone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A)  Peering through a gap in the drapes of his Malibu hou VIKTOR watches MAX dig through his trash.  Max finds a beat up reel of 16mm film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAX holds the end up to the light -- his eyes pop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B)  The ECHO headline screams, "SIMONE'S HARD CORE PAST" shows censored film frames of a naked Simone in a compromising position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR, hovering at a supermarket check-out line, overhears two WOMEN discussing the article.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disgusting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sympathetic) She must have been so desperate to do something like that, so depraved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm still naming my baby after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're having a boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor blanches.  It is not the reaction he'd hoped for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C)  Inside a theater, VIKTOR hovers by the door, smirking

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SCREEN, we hear a farmyard scene -- SIMONE in an empty farmyard on all fours, grunting like a pig, and foraging for muddy vegetables.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The AUDIENCE is shocked, then suddenly breaks into spontaneous applause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor, enraged, exits into the lobby past the poster for "I AM PIG - Starring Simone".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D)  A pretentious FILM CRITIC talks to camera, a film pos behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Simone to do something as brave as "I AM PIG" at this point in her career, with so much to lose -- all I can say is, "I Am Pig, I Am Oscar".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: E)  In his soundstage, VIKTOR moves a slider that adds wrinkles to Simone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: F)  SIMONE appears on a morning talk show -- as usual, re on a TV screen.  However, her squeaky-clean image has gone -- hair unkempt, bloated, chain-smoking and drinking during the interview.  The HOSTS are smiling weakly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simone, that's a rather controversial position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just think all elementary schools should have a firing range -- so students can learn how to defend themselves.  We could fit it inbetween recess and American History.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another clip:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If there's a hole in the ozone layer why can't I see it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another clip:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Immigration?!  God, isn't it crowded enough?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as we always knew.  Simone's not like other celebrities.  She speaks her mind!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: G)  VIKTOR driving along a city street, suddenly slams on brakes, almost causing an accident.  He stares numbly up at a twenty-foot high smiling photo of Simone on a billboard featuring a huge cover of TIME MAGAZINE.  It reads, "SIMONE: WOMAN OF THE YEAR".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) She's trying to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Realizing what he's said, a thought comes into his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An inscription on a headstone reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remembered Virtually Forever

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR kneels at HANK's grave.  He places a bunch of flow there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (referring to the flowers) They're plastic, Hank.  I know that's the way you'd want it. (glancing to a Simone billboard outside the cemetery wall) She killed you, Hank.  Now she's killing me.  She's a serial killer. (ducking out of sight of the billboard as if Simone is watching him) But I don't know how to stop her.  She's taken on a life of her own.  I can't just come clean -- make some confession.  I've defrauded millions -- they'd turn on me.  And I can't put the genie back in the bottle.  If she stopped working -- dropped out of sight, they'd never let it rest.  I've tried to kill her career but they like her even more. (more desperate) What am I going to do, Hank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thought occurs to Viktor.  He slowly rises from behind Hank's headstone, revealing a forest of headstones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say another word, Hank.  You are truly a genius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sad but resolute VIKTOR sits in front of his monitor, SIMONE's face full screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He speaks into the voice synthesizer, Simone's face automatically speaking the words he speaks -- the final t he puts his words in her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter, Viktor?  You look so sad.  Don't you love me anymore?... It's over, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He switches off the synthesizer and speaks in his own voi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the only way, Simone.  If it's any consolation, you're going to live on in the public's heart like all the other tragic figures that went before their time.  There's no love like posthumous love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the screen, Simone is on the verge of tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you're thinking.  It's a phoney-baloney world.  The women are surgically enhanced, the athletes are on steroids, the singers are lip-syncing if they're even singing at all, the news is entertainment, the politicians are bought and paid for -- we're living one big lie.  So why shouldn't you live too?  You're more authentic than the people who adore you. (a trace of despair) And that's the problem.  You're looking at the real fraud.  I told myself this was all about the work but if that was the truth, it wouldn't matter to me -- and it does.  It wasn't that the artists had no respect for the art.  They had no respect for me.  Someone like you, you have so much love showered on you -- I just wanted to feel one tiny drop on my face.  I'm sorry, Simone.  Here I've been trying to convince the world that you exist, but I was really trying to convince them that I exist.  It's not that you aren't human, Simone, it's that I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor produces a disc from his jacket marked, "PLAGUE - 8.1".  He places the disc in the machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor sees that Simone is crying.  He touches a tear on own face and realizes her tears are in response to his ow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor hesitates -- a moment of doubt -- then presses "ENTER".  The image of SIMONE's face gradually begins to deconstruct -- pixel by pixel -- as the virus takes hold. The pixels collect into a pile at the bottom of his scree like dust.  Finally, the dust is blown away in a single digital breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment his attention is taken with a layer of dust his own desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor regards his own reflection in the now black screen His hard-drive now corrupted, he picks up his original di marked, "SIMULATION ONE".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses this disc into a steamer trunk he has loaded wi hundreds of discs relating to Simone's software.  He shut the lid and begins dragging the trunk towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor's yacht sits at anchor in the glassy waters of San Monica Bay -- "SIMONE" written on the stern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR manhandles the trunk to the railing.  A mournful p -- then he heaves it over the side.  The trunk sinks like stone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heart heavy, Viktor stares into the inky depths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A throng of REPORTERS and CAMERA CREWS.  A somber VIKTOR enters and takes a seat in front of a forest of microphon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is my sad and solemn duty to announce the tragic passing of Simone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gasp from the audience.  Then, an explosion of anguish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!!  What happened?!  Oh.  God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stepping forward, mustering the courage to ask the question) How did she die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rare virus. (pretending to compose himself) On her goodwill tour of the third world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she suffer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercifully, it was quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the back of the room are MAX SAYER and MILTON.  They a frozen in grief, a tear spills from Max's eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A)  "SIMON GONE - FADE TO BLACK", reads the cover of Vari

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B)  The announcement of her death appears on local TV new shows around the globe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C)  A carpet of bouquets and notes of commiseration sever yards wide completely surrounds Viktor's property including the driveway.  VIKTOR insensitively drives over the bouquets to the horror of the MOURNERS, including MAX SAYER and MILTON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D)  In a remote Mongolian encampment MONGOL HORSEMEN crow around a television showing a live picture of Simone's funeral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: E)  The HEARSE carrying Simone's "body" and the funeral procession led solemnly by VIKTOR, proceeds through the studio lot.  Distraught STUDIO STAFF toss flowers onto the hearse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: F)  The same television picture is playing on a televisio sitting on a stool in a WEST AFRICAN river.  LOCAL WOMEN stop washing their clothes to watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We tilt up from Hank's headstone to an ornate mausoleum o island in a lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simone's coffin is ferried across a bridge by PALLBEARERS from the studio.  Numerous MOURNERS follow behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR, ELAINE and a curiously dry-eyed LAINEY walk behin the coffin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Elaine) Can I see you later -- go away for the weekend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (horrified by the suggestion) How can you bring that up at a time like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coffin reaches the steps of the marble mausoleum.  A PRIEST, RABBI, and a BUDDHIST MONK turn to Viktor.  He no and they start to carry the coffin towards the door.  However, the coffin is suddenly stopped by a POLICE OFFIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SECOND POLICE OFFICER begins to jimmy open the lid.  Th coffin lid is pulled back.  Inside is a life-sized cardbo standee of Simone from "ETERNITY FOREVER".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MOURNERS gasp.  Everyone looks to Viktor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE sits in the interview room, describing Viktor's assa on the standee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I heard him say, "Die bitch".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A)  MAX SAYER, distraught and weeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- He was a controlling madman, she was a prisoner.  I blame myself... I should have done more to stop it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B)  NICOLA gives a statement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- It was strange.  He wanted to replace her with me in his new movie... and I know I'm not that good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR sits in an interrogation room in a sea of SIMONE.  Magazine covers, cosmetics advertisements, publicity shot interviews, website print-outs, photographs and report ca from her fictitious childhood are plastered on the walls, stacks of film cans and tapes of her numerous movie and television appearances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Forgive me, Mr. Taransky.  I'm just trying to understand.  All these films, TV appearances, magazine covers, internet interviews, publicity photos, snapshots from her childhood -- all fake. (referring to various items) This is fake, this is fake -- fake, fake, fake, all fake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.  You understand perfectly.  I will confess to fraud, not murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (referring to oversize mail bags) A fan club with a worldwide membership in the millions -- also bogus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no.  The fan club is real.  But they were worshipping computer code -- ones and zeros.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, of course, you couldn't kill Simone because there never was a Simone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this Mr. Hank Aleno who you talk so much about, a renowned failure, who also happens to be so conveniently dead -- perhaps the "man" you claim helped invent Simone is an invention himself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor, sensing his sarcasm, does not reply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (patronizing smile) But not everyone's imaginary, are they, Mr. Taransky?  I refer, of course, to Edith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Detective raises a window-blind to reveal a next door room where the OLD WOMAN from the rest home is being interviewed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman you admitted to a journalist is Simone's mother and for whose silence you paid a fortune?  Is she not flesh to you -- are her tears not wet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The OLD WOMAN glances up and sees all the photos of Simon through the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My BABY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Detective abruptly lowers the blind.  Viktor rolls hi eyes at the Detective's theatrics.  He is suddenly enrage

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's insane!  This whole thing is insane!  There is no Simone.  Look! (grabbing a Simone poster) Even her name is fake.  It's not Simone. (he tears Simone's name in half to demonstrate) It's SIM... ONE!  Simulation One!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Detectives sadly shake their heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (regarding Simone's face also torn in half) You really hated her, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Detective places a tape, marked "EXHIBIT A" in a vide machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps you could explain this to me, Mr. Taransky -- or is this tape "doctored" too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He plays a tape showing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR dragging his trunk from his car down the pier to h yacht.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's footage from the marina's closed-circuit camera on the night in question.  Altered, of course.  Is that really what you expect us to believe, Mr. Taransky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Detective freezes the tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you tell us why you were disposing of the body of a woman who didn't exist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't her body.  It was her body of work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you just come clean, Viktor?  Tell the truth.  You'll feel better afterwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am telling the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coming close to him) We all know what happened.  In a fit of jealous rage you killed Simone and dumped her body off a boat she bought for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!!  I can prove it to you.  I'll take you to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR sits handcuffed on a POLICE BOAT with the DETECTIV and his LAWYER.  DIVERS surface with the steamer trunk.  Viktor's face lights up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trunk is winched aboard.  However, as it lowers onto deck, we see the latch has broken and the lid is ajar.  A eyes stare inside the trunk as the lid is lifted.  Apart a scrawny piece of kelp -- empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panicky, desperately grabbing the divers) Did you find anything else -- drivers, discs... disc-drives?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. (gazing to the water) We couldn't stay down any longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes follow the diver's gaze to several SHARK FINS in water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "SIMONE"S BODY FEARED EATEN BY SHARKS"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The newspaper is being read by Viktor's LAWYER, sitting opposite Viktor in his cell.  VIKTOR is numb -- the likelihood of conviction slowly dawning on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Plead guilty and throw yourself on the mercy of the court.  It's the best deal you're going to get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) I could get the death penalty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You certainly will if you go to trial -- a jury in this kind of ugly mood.  You've killed an icon, for God's sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't kill anyone, Bernard, there was no one to kill!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (musing) An insanity defence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FIGURE sits at Viktor's computer.  LAINEY.  She scrolls through Viktor's files.  All empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lainey sighs.  ELAINE paces behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go, Lainey.  There's nothing here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine continues to pace as Lainey works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, it's so like your father.  Why can't people take responsibility for their actions anymore?  I can almost forgive him for killing Simone -- but denying her existence.  I can never forgive that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because obviously she existed, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it as surely as you're sitting here, sweetheart.  She was the most vital woman I ever met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you did meet her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.  What are you suggesting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean really meet her -- in the flesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine regards her daughter curiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it's embarrassing to admit it, mom, but when I think about it  -- honestly, I haven't.  I mean, it feels like I have.  I know more about her than members of my own family.  She's even in my dreams.  But I realized, going back through my diary, they were all TV appearances, near misses at parties, second-hand rumor, gossip on the internet.  I've never actually seen Simone up close, touched her, been in her physical presence.  Have you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unable to refute it) Well, I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- We don't believe daddy because we don't want to believe we were taken in too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to shake the notion from her head) Lainey, there's no evidence that Simone isn't real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to what you're saying, mom.  Is there any evidence she is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lainey finally tries another file.  She presses "EJECT". "PLAGUE" disc spits out of the machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (regarding the disc) There's one part of dad's story that may have been true.  Simone may have contracted a virus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lainey smiles at her mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certain viruses can be cured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR sits in his cell, arms crossed, quietly seething, while his LAWYER lays out his trial strategy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hushed tones, referring to a thick Psychiatric Report) ... Listen, I've found a psychiatrist in Ventura -- well respected -- who's willing to testify under oath that you have diminished capacity due to the trauma of your divorce, ten years of abject failure in the movie business and a bump on the head you sustained as a child --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR, fuming throughout this, suddenly explodes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- No!  I can't go along with this horseshit!  Just tell them they can fry me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aghast, looking around to see if anyone has heard) What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was premeditated -- I knew exactly what I was doing!  I strangled her!  I bludgeoned her!  I set her on fire!  I did it!  I killed her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clearing his throat) Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lawyer spins around guiltily.  The Detective stands outside the cell, clearly overhearing the confession.  Viktor, resigned to his fate, couldn't care less.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you'd better see this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Detective switches on the TV set hanging outside the cell.  VBC is playing -- "BREAKING NEWS" --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A NEWS ANCHOR appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from TV) -- Breaking news -- international media star, Simone, is alive and well.  Her studio released this footage only minutes ago...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The brief clip shows the front page of the L.A. Times -- headlines: "HOLLYWOOD SUSPENDS FILMING IN MEMORY OF SIMON and "D.A. Seeks Death Penalty for Taransky".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reader lowers the newspaper to reveal herself -- SIMO on the studio lot, looking more beautiful than ever.  She winks to the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Simone reading today's edition of the L.A. Times.  Who says, "The only bad publicity is your obituary"?  Details at the top of the hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TV is switched off.  Viktor stares at the screen, try to take it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're indestructible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he looks back to the Detective, he discovers him hol the cell door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head in pity) I'll never get you Hollywood people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A throng of REPORTERS, PAPARAZZI and ONLOOKERS parts like sea for VIKTOR, released from custody.  One placard reads "ASK JESUS TO SAVE YOU NOW".  He is escorted to a waiting limousine where he is met by ELAINE and LAINEY.  He hugs both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIKTOR sits beside ELAINE.  LAINEY sits opposite, studyin her laptop computer.  Outside the car, REPORTERS are pres against the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relaxing back into his seat) Thank you! (to Lainey) I don't know how you did it but thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (putting her arm around him) Don't thank us too fast, Viktor.  You know what we have to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (resigned smile) Why stop at one character when you can have a whole cast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.  Now that you have the studio behind you, we can really do things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor shrugs resignedly, savoring his freedom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding Viktor close) I was thinking -- what about you and... "Simone" moving back in with me and Lainey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (meeting her gaze) That sounds wonderful. (to Lainey) How do you feel about all this, Lainey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beaming) About you and mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reluctant admission) Me and Simone.  What I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sweet smile) Your mistake wasn't making something fake, daddy.  We're fine with fake -- as long as you don't lie about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once again his daughter's words have a ghastly ring of tr Viktor stares out of the limo window as the car gradually forces its way through the reporters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He recognizes MAX and MILTON amongst the mob.  Max has hastily scribbled a note that he presses against the window --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "WILL PAY $ FOR EXCLUSIVE".  Viktor looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kissing him on the cheek) Don't look so glum, Viktor.  It's not a death sentence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still staring out of the window, a rueful smile) No... it's life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK BRAND conducts a remote interview with SIMONE who appears as usual on a television monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Simone, the question on everyone's mind is simply... "why?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, you know as well as I do, living in a fish bowl, the insatiable appetite of the media...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank nods sympathetically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With everything that was going on in my life, I just needed to drop out of sight for a while -- I needed time.  Viktor bought me that time.  I owe him so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all do. (quickly returning to Simone) But now I understand you're eager to get back to work -- and not the kind of work that we're all expecting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles coyly) That's true.  I can reveal that I am considering a career in politics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what may I ask brought this on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIMONE holds up a beautiful BABY BOY to camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose this little man had something to do with it.  Viktor and I are both concerned about what kind of world our new son, Chip, is going to grow up in. (turning lovingly to Viktor) Aren't you, Viktor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Frank Brand's monitor, the camera pulls back to reveal VIKTOR, sitting on a sofa -- an idyllic domestic scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning lovingly to Simone) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only we see the set where the interview is being recorded VIKTOR is sitting on a sofa against a green screen in his soundstage, smiling at a woman and child who are not ther he is alone.
